She is asking for a loan in order to purchase materials needed for her car wash (a water compresserm 50 meters of electrical wire and 20 liters of liquid soap) in order to maximize her profits. All four of her children attend school and she hopes to use her profits to ensure they have at least two meals a day. She hopes to keep them in school until they are ready to enter a University.

loans.use: purchase 1 water compresser, 50 meters of electrical wire and 20 liters of liquid soap

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú tiene 34 años de edad, es casada  y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de servicio de seguridad, ellos residen en la Colonia Sosa Lobo, de la ciudad de Juticalpa, Olancho. Marilú inicio vendiendo baleadas en su casa, luego decidió poner el negocio de venta de golosinas, su  horario laboral es de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm, su ventaja es que tiene mucha clientela y el único problema que enfrenta es porque tiene que pagar renta por el local. Marilú esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una refrigeradora ya que la necesita para poder vender refrescos y agua en su negocio para así ofrecerles mas variedad a sus clientes. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir sus gastos. Su meta es lograr tener su propio local y así dejar de pagar alquiler, su sueño es poder hacer su casa y ayudar a sus hijos a realizarse profesionalmente. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Marilú is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works at a security company and they live in the Sosa Lobo neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa, Olancho. Marilú started selling baleadas [ a Honduran delicacy] from her house. Later she decided to start selling candies and snacks. Her daily schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. The advantage is that she has a lot of customers and the only problem she faces is paying the rent for the locale. Marilú is asking for the loan to invst in buying a refrigerator since she needs to be able to sell beverages and water at her business for her customers to have more variety. With the support of this loan, she will be able to get the attention of more customers and continue having an economic activity that will allow her to cover her expenses. Her goal is to have her own locale and thus stop paying rent. Her dream is to build her bouse and help her children to become professionals. This is her first cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Juliana tiene un puesto en el mercado de su zona, allí vende productos de abarrotes. Esto es azúcar, arroz, fideos y toda clase de menestras. tiene cerca de 05 años trabajando y  le va muy bien, su clientela siempre acude a su negocio en busca de buenos precios, el negocio está ubicado en su misma casa y junto a su esposo comparten labores él se dedica a repartir los productos a diferentes bodegas, mercados y restaurantes y ella atiende a los compradores que acuden a su tienda,  gracias a su trabajo han logrado terminar la construcción de su casa, también han adquirido 2 moto taxis que dan en alquiler lo cual le genera otras ganancias, lo que más desea la Sra. Juliana es comprarse un puesto de venta en algún mercado para poner otra sucursal de su negocio, su préstamo le servirá para seguir incrementando su tienda con la compra de mas productos. Juliana es socia del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO”  ya tiene varios años trabajando junto a sus compañeras de grupo.

*Juliana viste chaleco azul y polo naranja.
texts.en:
Juliana has a spot in the area market where she sells grocery items. These are sugar, rice, pasta and all types of vegetable stews. She has been doing this work for close to 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her customers always go to her business seeking good prices. The business is located in her house and she divides the work between her and her husband. He delivers products to different stores, markets and restaurants and she attends to customers who go to her store. Thanks to their work, they have been able to finish construction on their home. They have also acquired 2 motorcycle taxis that they rent out to generate more income. What Juliana wants the most is to buy a sales spot in some market to open up another branch of her business. Her loan will be used to keep growing her store by buying more products. Juliana is a member of the “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO” group and has been working with the members for several years.

*Juliana is wearing a blue vest and an orange shirt.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty wants to buy a plot of land. She is single mother living in Masindi, Uganda and charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children. She has a bar. She began as a bar attendant in someone’s bar and after saving her wages she rented a room and started her own bar. Theft and seasonal weather hinders her business. 

She desires to build a permanent home and to buy land and grow crops.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in brick-making for two years and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children up to university level.

Justine wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David wants a loan to buy general merchadise such as sugar and cooking oil to sell. He is a twenty-four-year-old harworking man living in Masindi, Uganda. For three years he has been operating a retail shop and with the proceeds he has been able to have all the basics.

He desires to educate himself and expand his business into new markets, despite challenges including inadequate capital to invest in the business.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a forty-seven-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years. He started with 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings as working capital. His hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuation and inflation. His personal goal is educating his children while his business goals are expanding business into new markets and diversifying his business to include farming.

Josephat wants money to buy sugar, soap, soft drinks and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soft drinks and salt to sell.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne is a 27-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She has been knitting sweaters for five years. She started her business with 50,000 UGX and now has 1,000,000 UGX. Her hardships are customers not paying on time, inadequate capital to purchases stock, price fluctuations and inflation.

Evelyne's personal goals are to educate children and herself. Her business goals are to hire employees to help expand her business, move her business to a more permanent location and expand her business into new markets. Evelyne is requesting a loan to buy spools of thread for knitting sweaters.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread for knitting sweaters.

loans.name: Bisogho

texts.en:
Bisogho is a 30-year-old, married woman with three children. She and her family live in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the hotel/restaurant business for five years. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. 

Bisogho's personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. Her business goals are to buy land on which to grow crops and to expand her business into new markets. Bisogho is requesting a loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 43-year-old, married man with four children. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the firewood business for two and a half years. His hardships are high taxes, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations and inflation. 

Alfred's personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goals are to buy land on which to grow crops and to expand his business to new markets. Alfred is requesting a loan to buy firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Ando

texts.en:
Ando is involved in agriculture. He cultivates land and raises cattle. Ando has been involved in this business for many years and has created all the necessary conditions with which to develop his farm. 

Ando plans to purchase cows, which will allow him to earn more income from the sales of agricultural products. Ando plans to build a new barn and continue increasing the number of his cattle. The addiitional income from the use of this loan will give him an opportunity to implement these goals. 

Ando lives with his wife, three children and parents. Agriculture is the main source of income for the entire family, so Ando is determined to develop his business in order to cover the family's cost of living.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives in Metsamor town with her family, including her parents, brother, sister-in-law and little cousin. About two years ago Hranush's family started their own business by renting a shop and starting a business, where they sell cosmetics, accessories and household goods. 

Hranush has applied for this loan to purchase a larger variety of inventory for the shop. This will allow Hranush to earn more income from the business, which is vital for her family to meet their needs. 

Hranush and her family plan to start their own shop without renting a premise. Additional income will allow her to fulfill this purpose.

loans.use: to pay for inventory for the shop

loans.name: Affoussa Evelyne

texts.fr: Affoussa Evelynen est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Elle vend des tissus, des pagnes et des bazins depuis des années ans et deux de ses enfants  vont à l'école. Affoussa Evelyne s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ses clients sont des habitants du quartier et de ses environs. Elle veut acheter des tissus, des pagnes et des bazins. Affoussa Evelyne avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et épargner. Elle ambitionne garantir des soins médicaux adéquats pour ses enfants et aider son mari à construire leur maison.
texts.en: Affoussa Evelynen is married and the mother of three children aged between 10 years and 3 years old, 2 of whom attend school. She has been selling cloths, pagnes and bazins (both traditional articles of clothing in Benin) for several years. She stocks up in a market in Benin and her customers live in the neighborhoods surrounding her home. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more merchandise. She wants to use her profits to help her children attend school and save the remaining funds. She hopes to some day be able to purchase adequate medicines for her children when needed and support her husband in the building of their home.

loans.use: purchase two rolls of cloth, 30 page (traditional loincloths) and 8 bazins (another traditional article of clothing)

loans.name: Agabus

texts.en:
Agabus is a fifty-three-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling firewood for two years. He started with 70,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. His hardships are high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent home and cultivating land for crops. His business goals are buying land to grow crops and expanding his business to new markets.

Agabus wants the money to buy trees for firewood.

loans.use: to buy trees for firewood.

loans.name: Neckson

texts.en:
Neckson is a 36-year-old, married man with three children. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a civil servant for three years. During this time in service he has been able to buy land where he intends to build his residential house.

Neckson's personal goals are to build a permanent home and educate his children up to the university level. Neckson requests a loan to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.
He has been a game warden for Ugandan wildlife for three years. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs which affect his ability to optimally provide the basics to his family since he earns a low salary. 

His personal goal is self education and his business goal is to venture into the transport business so as to increase his income sources.Tadeo wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker and he has been in banking for two years. His personal goal is educating his child up to university level and also upgrading his own studies.

Robert intends to use the money to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself..

loans.name: Misuless

texts.en:
Misuless is a thirty-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a bar business for one year. Her hardship is inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. Her personal goal is educating her children and her business goal is hiring employees to help expand the business.

Misuless wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband she runs a farm, where they cultivate land and raise livestock. In order to increase the number of cattle, Lida has applied for this loan. 

With the requested amount she plans to purchase four young cattle. This will allow Lida to breed the cattle and continue increasing their number. Lida hopes to produce more agricltural products, from the sales of which her family gets its income. 

Lida currently lives with her husband, daughter-in-law and little grandchild.

loans.use: to pay for four young cattle.

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Paulina de 53 años tiene 03 hijos es casada y  su esposo trabaja como tornero, ella tiene un  negocio de venta de comidas cuando empezó solo tenía una carreta pequeña con la que se movilizaba por diferentes zonas, después de un tiempo logro comprarse un triciclo más grande, una vitrina y algunas banquitas. el negocio lo instalo en la puerta de su casa, allí prepara variados potajes como picarones, cachangas y yuquitas los que ofrece a los consumidores que acuden al lugar, gracias a su trabajo es que ha podido pagar los estudios de una de sus hijas, para más adelante quiere buscar un lugar más grande donde poner su negocio esta vez usara su préstamo para comprar utensilios de cocina y algunas ollas deterioradas, la alcancía que integra es “SOLIDARIDAD”  donde es socia cerca de 5 años.
*Paulina aparece en la foto sentada y viste chompa negra y blusa blanca
texts.en: Paulina is 53 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a lathe operator and she has a food business. When she started out, she only had a small cart which she wheeled through different neighborhoods. After a while, she managed to buy a larger, three-wheeled cart, a display case and some benches, and set up her business just outside her house. There she prepares a variety of different foods such as picarones, 'cachangas' (a bread-like fried dough) and 'yuquitas' (yucca fries) which she sells to customers. Thanks to this work, she has been able to pay for one of her daughter's studies. However, in the future, she would like to find larger premises where she can set up her business. On this occasion, Paulina will use her loan to buy cooking utensils and some new pans as the ones she currently uses are worn. Paulina's community bank is called 'Solidaridad' (Solidarity). She has been a member for five years. * In the photo, Paulina is sitting down wearing a black sweater and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and pans

loans.name: Jivan

texts.en:
Jivan runs a shop selling electronic goods. He has a large variety of electronic and computer devices and accessories. Jivan would like to add new models of devices in his shop, which is why he has applied for this loan. 

With the requested amount he plans to purchase new models of TV sets. This will allow Jivan to have an advantage in the market. 

Jivan lives with his wife and three children. Being the main breadwinner in the family, Jivan sees it as important that he is able to expand and develop his business so he can earn more income and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase TV sets.

loans.name: Fayiah T.

texts.en:
Fayiah T. is 40 years old and lives in Compound#3 with his wife and children. His children, who are aged between six and sixteen, are in school. Fayiah stopped his education when he was in 12th grade. 

Since 2009, he has been running a shop where he sells artificial hair and other items. He started this business with help from his brother. One of the problems he faces is transporting the goods to his shop.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair and other items for his business. He likes the way his business keeps him busy. His plan is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair and other items for his business.

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Justina  tiene 49 años es docente de profesión. Ella tiene una librería a la que le ha puesto el nombre de su hijo “LIBRERÍA ALEXIS”  su  negocio  ya tiene cerca de 20 años, fue  gracias  a su hermano que ella aprendió todo sobre ese negocio  actualmente tiene 2 tiendas una en su casa y otra en una universidad, gracias a los prestamos de EDAPROSPO pudo abrir su segunda tienda esto le ha permitido seguir creciendo y lograr muchas cosas  lo más importante es haberle brindado a su hijo buenos estudios ,construir su casa y terminar su profesión con una maestría. todos sus logros son fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo arduo. La Sra. Justina es miembro de la alcancía “FUTURO PARA EL BIEN” con su préstamo actual podrá seguir invirtiendo en útiles escolares, con el fin de tener bien surtido su negocio para ofrecer variedad de artículos a sus clientes.
* La Sra. Justina viste blusa negra con blanco.
texts.en:
Justina is 49 years old and a teacher by profession.  She has a bookstore called 'Librería Alexis' which she has been running for nearly 20 years.  She learned everything she needed to know about this business from her brother.  Justina currently has two stores: one in her home and another in a university.  She was able to open her second store thanks to loans from EDAPROSPO.  This allowed her to continue growing in her business and achieve many things.  Most importantly, she has managed to provide her son with a good education, build her own home and gain a Masters degree.  All of her achievements are the fruit of her determination and hard work.  Justina is a member of the 'Futuro para el Bien' community bank.  She will invest her current loan in buying school supplies so that her business is well stocked and she is able to offer a variety of goods to her customers.

* Justina is wearing a black and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband and son she keeps a farm, where they cultivate land, grow fruit trees and raise livestock. Anahit would like to increase the number of livestock she owns, for which she needs sufficient means. With the help of this loan, she plans to purchase a pig, a cow and a calf. The farm has all the necessities for livestock: a barn and forage to feed them. So purchasing more livestock will bring Anahit more income and the opportunity to continue the development of the farm.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, a cow and a calf.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Juntos Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Gresia tiene 03 años trabajando en la venta de productos de belleza. Ella ofrece diferentes marcas del mercado y por la variedad sus clientas van en aumento, fue por medio de su mama que aprendió acerca del negocio; esto le ha servido para ayudar en la economía de su familia gracias e este trabajo ha podido comprar algunas cosas que le hacían falta dentro de su hogar, una cocina y  refrigeradora, también ayuda a pagar algunos servicios, además de esto trabaja como recepcionista en un gimnasio y es donde capta más clientes que la ayudan a realizar más ventas, su préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mas productos básicamente perfumes y colonias. Gresia es secretaria de la alcancía “JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO”  ya son 2 años que pertenece al grupo y su mayor deseo en el futuro es seguir ahorrando para tener un spa y salón de belleza.
*Gresia viste casaca blanca.
texts.en:
Gresia has been selling cosmetics for 3 years. She offers different brands, which has increased her clientele. She learned her trade from her mother; it has helped her provide for her family, pay utilities, and buy some things that were needed in her household: a kitchen and refrigerator.

She also works as a receptionist in a gym, where she meets clients who buy her cosmetics. With this loan, she will buy more basic products, particularly perfumes and colognes. Gresia is secretary of the communal bank “JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO” [Triumphant Together], to which she has belonged for 2 years. Her most important wish is to continue saving so that she can have a spa and beauty salon. 

*Gresia is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene la edad de 39 años, soltero, labora como técnico en computación, en una empresa privada, vive junto a sus padres y su mayor ahnelo es mejorar la vivienda, haciendo un muro, para reguardar su propiedad. Dando a sus padres mejor seguridad.
Pues se había hecho difícil, ya que no tenía mucho dinero ahorrado, pará comenzar, pero Afodenic, me ha otorgado un financiamiento en donde comprare materiales   y comenzar la construcción del muro. Satisfecho por esta obra, y que espera avanzar bastante.
texts.en: Carlos is 39 years old, single and works as a computer technician in a private company.  He lives together with his parents and his biggest wish is to improve their home, building a wall in order to protect their property.  This will make his parents safer.  It has been difficult because Carlos didn't have much money saved up to start the work.  However, Afodenic have given him a loan to buy materials and start building his wall.  He is happy and hopes to make quite a lot of progress.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for building a wall

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew lives in Liberia, is 40 years old and is married, with four children. He has a 6th grade education. Since 2005 he has been operating a gas station, which he enjoys. Drivers prefer buying gas from Andrew because he has a good location and he was previously a taxi driver. He learned this way of doing business from his parents. 

One problem he faces is that he has an insufficient income. Andrew is requesting a loan to purchase more gas for his business. He plans to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more gas for his business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Alfonso sigue con negocio de fotografía, el cual ha modernizado y comprado mas equipo para su buen servicio, en donde acude a eventos en la toma de fotos, videos, escaneo, entre otros que ofrece. Hoy en día es más fácil su trabajo ya que cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para agilizar y dar mejor resolución a sus fotos.
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara un televisor plasma LCD de 32", con el fin de seguir mejorando su trabajo y tecnología.Ofreciendo a sus clientela rapidez y calidad.
texts.en:
Alfonso continues with his photography business, which he has updated with more equipment that allows him to provide good service. He attends events where he takes photos and videos and offers scanning, among other services. He work is much easier today because he has the tools needed to speed up processing and improve the resolution of his photos. 

With this loan, he will buy a 32" LCD plasma TV to continue improving his work and technology and offering his clients speed and quality.

loans.use: to buy a plasma TV so that he can work faster.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in Dastakert town with her husband, son and daughter. The family has a farm, where they raise their three cows and a calf, as well as grow potatoes and walnut, apple and pear trees. Svetlana would like to start sheep breeding, for which she wants to purchase 10 sheep. In addition, she plans to hire workers to cut the grass on the farm, which she will use as forage to feed the livestock.
 
This loan will help Svetlana to earn additional income from sheep breeding and to keep the farm running, which will provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep and cutting the grass

loans.name: Adjorman Group

texts.en: Janet (pictured in the center) is a member of the Adjorman group. They sell rice, sugar, hair and body creams, perfumes and roll-ons in the Teshie neighborhood of Accra. Her 900 GHS loan will allow her to increase her inventory and hopefully increase her profits. Janet has been selling these types of products for eight years. This is her fifth loan cycle, having successfully repaid four previous loans with ID Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, hair and body creams, perfumes, and roll-ons to sell

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
José Tomas, trabaja siempre en acarreo comercial, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa quien es comerciante también, sus hijos cursando el año escolar, hoy en día, don José, da mantenimiento a su vehículo, siendo el eje principal de su trabajo y pan de cada día.
José ha logrado estas mejoras del vehículo, con préstamos en Afodenic, en donde cada doce a seis meses da mantenimiento general, con el fin de dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, hasta la puerta de su casa. Lo que se siente contento por poder seguir adelante, y con este nuevo financiamiento podrá comprar cuatro llantas nuevas, cambio de filtro, dirección y afinado de motor.
texts.en:
José Tomas is in the commercial transport business.  He has the support of his wife who also works in commerce.  Their children are in school.  José needs to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle as it is his source of income and support.

José has managed to make improvements to his vehicle through loans from Afodenic.  Every six to twelve months, he has general maintenance work carried out so that he can provide his customers with a good service right up to their doors.  He feels happy that he is able to make progress in life.  With this new loan, he will be able to buy four new tires, replace his filter and steering, and tune his engine.

loans.use: to buy new tires and have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Greta

texts.en: Greta lives with her husband and son. The family is involved in agriculture. On the family farm they grow apple, apricot, cherry and peach trees, keep a grape orchard and raise cattle. Greta needs some financial investment to cultivate her orchard, for which she wants to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. Greta also plans to purchase fuel to take the harvest to local markets. In addition, she wants to construct a special freezer, in which she will keep fruit to sell in winter. This will allow Greta to have a stable income all year round and to continue investing in the further development of her farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticide, and fuel and for the construction of a freezer.

loans.name: Heghinar

texts.en:
Heghinar lives in Armash village with her family -- a brother, parents, and grandmother. The family runs a farm, which provides their main source of income. They grow melons, watermelons, and grapes to sell at the local markets. 

Heghinar has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. She will also pay for the costs connected with cultivation and hiring workers. 

This loan is important for Heghinar and her family so they can improve the conditions on the farm and gather a good harvest this year.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticide and land cultivation expenses.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en: Abubakari (the male in the photo) is a shoemaker and a member of the Truth Group. He is taking out his fourth loan with ID Ghana, having successfully paid off three previous loans. With this 300 GHS loan (his portion of the total loan), he will purchase leather and a solution to preserve leather, which he will use to make more shoes.

loans.use: To purchase leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Binyomoo Ogbede Group

texts.en: The Binyomoo Ogbede group is a group of women fishsellers who are located in the Teshie community of Accra, Ghana. Naomi is a group member who sells fish from her home. She is pictured second from the right. This will be Naomi's fifth loan with ID Ghana (she previously paid back four other loans successfully). This 800 GHS loan (Naomi's portion of the total loan) will allow Naomi to purchase more fish to sell. Naomi lives with her husband Stephen, who is a mason. The two have three children, aged 17-21, who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en: Linda (pictured left) is a member of the Yehowa No group, which is based in the Teshie district of Accra, Ghana. Linda sells rice, sugar, and soup from her home, where she lives with her 7-year-old son. Her son attends school during the day. This 500 GHS loan (her portion of the total loan) will be Linda's third loan with ID Ghana; she paid back the first two successfully.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell from her home.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es: Maria vive en Isla Trinitaria, tiene 31 años y viven con sus hijos en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de refrescos la cual empezó hace más de 10 años vendiendo de manera ambulante. Pasado un tiempo con la regeneración urbana tuvo la oportunidad de comprar un pequeño local que vende el municipio el cual cuenta con los servicios básicos. El negocio lo maneja personalmente y cuando necesita realizar alguna gestión deja a una de sus hermanas a cargo. En su local ofrece jugos de frutas naturales, batidos, sanduches, por lo general tiene más acogida en las mañanas ya que sus clientes compran para llevar de desayuno. Los costos van desde $ 0.50 ctv hasta $ 1.50 que cuestan los batidos. Los costos no son muy altos por lo que sus ganancias le permiten cubrir la educación de su hijo quien a los 8 años asiste a la escuela. Con el préstamo Maria desea comprar otro puesto más grande y continuar con el actual, la otra parte del crédito será para la compra de productos como frutas, leche, azúcar y utensilios que necesita para la venta.
texts.en:
Maria, 31, lives in Isla Trinitaria with her children in her parent's home. She sell drinks, a business she began 10 years ago as a street vendor. Over time and with urban redevelopment, she had the opportunity to buy from the city a small stand that included basic services. She personally manages the business and leaves one of her sisters in charge when she needs to attend to a business matter. 

She offers natural fruit juices, milkshakes, and sandwiches at her stand, which is busiest in the mornings because her customers buy them for breakfast. Prices range from $0.50 to $1.50 for milkshakes. Her costs are not very high; therefore, her profits allow her to pay for her 8-year-old son's education. With this loan, Maria wants to buy a larger stand to operate along with the one she has now; the rest of the loan will be used to buy products like fruit, milk, sugar, and utensils needed for the business.

loans.use: to buy fruit, milk, sugar, and utensils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edixon Elias

texts.es:
Edixon sigue laborando como mecanico, su esposa cuida de sus dos hijos  estudiantes. Para el las mejora a su vivienda ha sido de gran sastifaccion, logrando seguridad en su propiedad y su familia.
Ya construyo muro del otro extremo, ahora con este nuevo prestamo seguira con la parte perimetral , comprando piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para su construccion, en corto plazo, gracias a Afodenic por otorgar sus prestamo, y dar mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Edixon continues to work as a mechanic; his wife takes care of their two children who are students. Improving his home has given him great satisfaction and made his property and family more secure.

He built a wall on the far side. He can quickly build the perimeter wall and make the space more comfortable after purchasing stone, sand, cement, and iron rods for the construction with the help of the loan from Afodenic.

loans.use: to build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi is 33 years old and is married. He lives in a thatched house with his 27-year-old wife and a child in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Yi, as well as other villagers, is dedicated to the farming business to earn a living. He works along with his wife in the rice field and also goes fishing in a nearby stream every day to support his family. However, the income barely seems to cover his daily costs.

Due to an old and longstanding thatched house, Yi’s family has encountered difficulties in their life, especially during the rainy season. The house was affected by the rain and it’s not strong enough for the family to live in. In connection to this matter, Yi has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase wooden boards and lattice to fix his house. This will provide a comfortable living for the family and there’ll be no fear of them suffering in the rain. Yi thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase wooden boards and lattice to fix his house

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 25-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a teacher and has been in service for one and a half years. His hardship is low salary.  His personal goals are building a permanent home and upgrading his studies.  His business goal is buying land to grow crops so as to supplement his salary.

Nelson intends to use the loan to buy land for growing crops.

loans.use: to buy land for growing crops

loans.name: Rossachele Group

texts.en: Kwabena (pictured right) is a member of the Rossachele group based in the Teshie district of Accra, Ghana. Kwabena sells mobile phone credit cards along the street in his neighbourhood. With a loan of 350 GHS (his portion of the total loan), Kwabena will buy more credit to cell.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone credit to sell.

loans.name: Tsuihitoo Ernestina Group

texts.en:
This is a group called Tsuihitoo Ernestina with two members who sell sandals, clothing, slippers, towels, and fish at Teshie town market. Tsotsoo is 48 years old, whiles Ernestina is 53 years old. Both are married and have two children, between the ages of 3 and 21 years who are living with their parents in Teshie. This is the fourth loan cycle for Tsotsoo, while it is the second loan cycle for Ernestina.

Ernestina (standing left in the picture) sells sandals, slippers, and towels. She need this loan to buy ladies' clothing, slippers, sandals, and towels to sell. She can make a profit of GHS 80 per month, of which part will be used to support her husband and part to reinvest in her business. She needs a loan of GHS 500 (her portion of the total loan) to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothing, slippers, sandals, and towels to stock her business.

loans.name: Founfonsi Balbine

texts.fr: Founfonsi Balbine est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des céréales et de divers depuis des années ans, elle a à charge trois personnes et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours auprès de Finadev en vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les attentes de ses clients. Founfonsi Balbine avec ses économies veut participer à l'éducation de ses enfants et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Founfonsi Balbine is married and the mother of three children who attend school.  The oldest is 13 and the youngest is 5.  For years she has specialized in the sale of cereals and various products.  She has three people who work for her and she gets her supplies at one of the markets in Bénin.  She has experience with loans and has requested and obtained one through Finadev in order to increase her buying power and to fulfill the demands of her customers.  With her savings, Founfonsi Balbine wants to contribute to the education of her children and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of beans, and 6 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Esther Arlette Aoussouba

texts.fr: Esther Arlette est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés dans une école de la place. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgé a 5 ans. Elle a trois personnes à charge et s'est spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes, des chaussures et des bijoux depuis des années. Esther Arlette se ravitaille dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Sa clientèle est constituée en majorité des fonctionnaires. Dans le but de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients et d'accroitre son revenu additionnel, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un micro crédit à Finadev. Le surplus généré lui permettra de renforcer son stock et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Esther Arlette is married and the mother of three children who are all attending a local school. Her eldest child is 23 and her youngest is 5. She has three people in her care. Esther Arlette's business is selling pagnes, shoes and jewelry. She has been in this business for years. She re-stocks in a market in the area. Her customer base is mainly made up of civil servants. With the aim of responding favorably to her customer demand and increasing her income, Esther Arlette has requested and received a micro loan from Finadev. The profits she makes will allow her to boost her stock and help provide for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy ten 'pagnes', four lots of shoes and one dozen lots of jewelry

loans.name: Para Janet Group

texts.en:
Para Janet is a group made up of 5 women with the average age of 44 years and average number of children of 2. Three are married and the rest are not. They are into the sale of stationery, silver products and provisions. They buy their goods from the central market and sell in their community. They are in their fourth loan cycle.

Janet is a 50-year-old married women with 1 child. Her husband works with the Ministry of Agriculture in Ghana while the daughter is in high school. She sells cooking utensils and silver products. She buys from the central market in Accra and supplies to customers in Teshie. She need this loan to be able to meet customer demand. She makes a profit of 100 GHS monthly.

She needs an amount of 700 GHS to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy silver bowls, sliver pans and cups to supply to customers

loans.name: Ekome Janet Group

texts.en:
Janet and Adjeley are the members of this group who need a loan to buy more slippers and used clothing to sell. They are both single parents with three children each. They are in their third loan cycle.

Janet's daughter is a nurse who supplements Janet's efforts, but she still needs this loan to add to her capital so that she can buy more goods. She sells used clothing. Her ambition is to build a house for her family in the near future through an ID-Ghana loan product. Now, she needs a loan of 500 GHS (her portion of the total loan) to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock more items in their business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 23 años vive en la ciudad de Portoviejo dedicándose a la venta de encebollado. Vive con su familia en la casa de sus padres ya que no a tenido los suficientes ingresos para comprar una propia, su esposa Kety es ama de casa dedicada al cuidado de sus hijos, Mateo de 4 años que asiste al jardín y Melani de 13 años que está ya en la secundaria. Manuel empezó su negocio cuando se quedo sin trabajo ya que la empresa donde trabajaba realizo reducción de personal. Busco otra alternativa para tener ingresos ya que su familia depende de él, dando este negocio y hasta ahora le va muy bien. Tiene 3 años 3 meses con el negocio el cual atiende solo, levantándose a las 2 de la mañana para empezar la preparación del plato junto a su esposa. El encebollado es un plato típico de la gastronomía ecuatoriana y en su preparación se emplea: pescado cocido y desmenuzado, hierbas, cebolla, tomates, yuca, ajo, limón, sal, aceite de oliva, con estos ingredientes se empieza la preparación empezado a cocinar la yuca con el ajo, cebolla blanca, hierba buena, ají y tomate licuado. Cuando ya esté lista la yuca se debe sacar y poner a cocinar el pescado aliñado. Curtir la cebolla colorada con los limones. Colocar en una bandeja la yuca cortada en cuadritos. Luego el pescado cocinado y cortado en tiras, hierba picada, aceite de oliva y el caldo de pescado cernido, revolver toda esta mezcla. Se sirve calientito con canguil, chifles y rodajas de limón. El costo del plato varía entre $ 1.25 a $ 1.50 acompañado con una gaseosa.  Con el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mesas, sillas e ingredientes para los encebollados. En un futuro Manuel desea tener su propio local para poder generar mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 23, lives in the city of Portoviejo, and he sells “encebollado”.  He lives with his family in his parents’ house because he has not had enough income to buy his own.  His wife, Kety, is a housewife, and she takes care of the children.  Mateo is four years old, and he goes to pre-school, and 13 year old Melani is in high school.

Manuel started his business when he was left without work.  The company where he worked had a reduction in personnel.  He looked for another way to get income because his family depends upon him.  He has this business, and so far it is going very well for him.  He has had the business for three years and three months, and he takes care of it by himself.  He gets up at two in the morning to prepare, with his wife, the dish.  

The “encebollado” is a typical Ecuadorian dish.  To prepare it you use cooked, chopped fish, white onions, herbs, chilies, and liquefied tomato.  When the yucca is ready you need to take it and start cooking the dressed fish.  Brown the red onion with the limes.  Place the yucca cut in little squares on the serving dish.  Then add the cooked fish cut in strips, hot spices, olive oil, and the fish stock.  Stir it all together.  Serve hot with corn nuts, fried banana chips, and lime slices.  The dish costs between $1.25 and $1.50 with a soft drink.

The loan he is requesting is to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients for the encebollados.  In the future Manuel wishes to have his own place to be able to generate better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fish, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Karina Victoria

texts.es: Karina tiene 31 años y vive en Paraíso de la Flor con sus hijos. Tiene una casa propia la cual cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz. Hace 5 años empezó con el negocio de venta de productos de cosméticos por catálogos luego de que se separo de su esposo. La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos, también ofrece ropa la cual es traída por una amiga desde Perú ya que es más económico el producto. Karina por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar ropa, artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes. A futuro Karina desea continuar con la construccion de su domicilio el cual ya no es de caña.
texts.en:
Karina, 31, lives in Paraíso de la Flor with her children. She owns her own house, which has running water and electricity. Five years ago, she started selling catalog cosmetics; later, she separated from her husband. She travels to various sections of the city, offering her products to friends and acquaintances. She also sells clothing imported by a friend from Peru, where clothing is less expensive.

Karina has never been late with her payments and hopes to continue this record. With this loan, she will buy clothing and cosmetics such as lipstick, eye shadow, and perfume. In the future, Karina would like to continue improving her home, which is no longer made of cane.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, eye shadows, and perfumes.

loans.name: Feamo Ashami Group

texts.en:
Feamo Ashami is a group made up of 3 women with the average age of 40 years and the average number of children of 2. They are married. They are into the sale of fish, maize, towels, toothbrushes and cream. They buy their goods from the central market and sell in their community. They are in their second loan cycle.

Ashami is a 38-year-old married women with 1 child. Her husband works as a carpenter whiles her son is in a learning apprenticeship. She sells towels, toothbrushes and cream. She buys from the central market in Accra and sells to customers in Teshie. She hawks. She needs this loan to be able to meet customer demand. She makes a profit of 70 GHS monthly.

She needs an amount of 300 GHS to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more towels, toothbrushes and cream to sell to customers

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 45-year-old single mother with three children aged 17 and 15. Both are in school. She lives with the children in an extended family house where she sells maize, toothbrushes and toothpaste to cater for her children. The children help her to sell after school.

She needs this loan so that, after sales, she can make enough profit to take care of her children. Her ambition is to move into her own building 3 years from now. This is her first loan with ID-Ghana. She needs an amount of 300 Ghanian cedis to buy toothbrushes, toothpaste and maize to build her business.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, toothpaste and maize

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora has been in the business of retail for the last six years. She runs a canteen and food kiosk located at Kyotera Medical Center. Flora is married and has a good character. She applied for a loan of 3,000,000 shillings to be paid back over a period of twelve months and the purpose of the loan is to buy more stock for her business.

She is affected mainly by the high cost of food items, which leads to a hike in the price of food therefore reducing sales. She dreams of buying a large piece of land where she can do extensive agriculture so that she can supply most of her own food items to increase her profit margins. Flora is very hard working and innovative.

loans.use: To buy stock and food items for her canteen.

loans.name: Altayr Group

texts.en: This group, called Altayr, consists of four members, three of whom are female: The females are Ghzal, Antsar and Suad, who is the group leader. The one male is Ali. They are from Taiz, Yemen, and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same area for a long time. They have different businesses. They have requested a loan of 150,000 YER. Suad is a 45-year-old married woman who has an adult child. She is the woman who wears glasses. She is a seamstress who sews ladies' clothes for neighborhood clients. She started on her own business 20 years ago. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. It is her main source of income. Currently Suad is asking for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a new sewing machine. This will help her complete client orders on time and increase her profits. With her current machine, she is unable to finish orders on time. She would like to own a house in order to live a good life with her son.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
Lida tiene 42 años, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, alegre y muy carismática. Su pareja es Fernando, fruto de esa unión tienen cuatro hijos: Fernando, Brandon, Jordán y Emily de 20, 16, 11 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Su casa es propia, la cual lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo.

Su actividad es la venta de mercadería variada como sábanas, toallas, ropa, pasamanería, perfumes, entre otros. Lo realiza desde su casa, hace más de 10 años, empezó con un capital propio, viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa, atender a sus hijos y tener tiempo libre para otras actividades. Por otro lado, lo malo es que tiene que caminar varias horas al día, ofreciendo sus productos, pero eso no la desanima. 

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal, apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.
Con el préstamo solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería variada (toallas, sábanas, ropa y sandalias), buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Lida, age 42, is a hard-working, enterprising, cheerful, and very charismatic woman.  Fernando is her life partner, and they have four children, Fernando, Brandon, Jordán, and Emily, ages 20, 16, 11, and 3.  They have their own house, which they managed to buy with a lot of effort.

She sells varied merchandise like sheets, towels, clothes, handicrafts, and perfume, among others.  She has been doing this from home for over ten years.  She started with her own capital as she saw the need for an additional income.  She likes her business because it allows her to be in the comfort of her home, tend to her children, and to have free time for other activities.  The bad part is having to walk several hours a day selling her products, but this does not discourage her.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue with her objectives.  She likes the work her communal bank is doing, supporting people to advance in their businesses. 

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy various merchandise (towels, sheets, cloths, and sandals), looking to get low prices for buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy towels, sheets, clothes, and shoes to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Al-Malkia Group

texts.en: This group is called AL-Malkia. It is made up of four women, Zubaidh, Amh, Najah, and Fawziah, who are neighbors from Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They seek a loan of 200,000 YER. Zubaidh is the group's leader (in the photo, she is the woman seated in the center). She is 42 years old, married and has four children. She has been a hairdresser for three years. One of Zubaidh's goals is to continue to grow her business. Since she has professional experience in this field, she has attracted more clients helping her business to succeed and be more profitable. She has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to invest in her business by buying cosmetic materials. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. She hopes to earn large profits so that she can increase her savings in order to expand her business and open a big beauty salon and wedding dress store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials for a hairdressing business.

loans.name: Amjd Group

texts.en: AL-HABA Group is made up of four young men, Amjd, Abdulbary, Muath and A`ala, who are friends in Sana`a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 160,000 YER as financial support to expand their businesses. Amjd is 21 years old, single and works in the trading center. He lives with his family in Sana`a. (He is the man seated in the center). He says he loves his job. Amjd has requested a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a laptop computer.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 39-year-old hardworking married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent house for her family's residence. She has been running a pub business for the last nine years. Her main hardship is inadequate capital to meet the high demand and limited space to operate from since she has a lot of customers.She has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and owning a hotel.Margret needs a loan to buy beer, soda and local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Talar's Group

texts.en:
Talar is a 25-year-old young Iraqi woman. She is married with two children. Her family lives in a very modest neighborhood on the edge of the city where hard-working families are trying their best to improve their living conditions and opportunities. Talar is also trying to participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income.

She has five years of experience in working from home. A year ago, she was already able to benefit from a microfinance opportunity. She successfully received and repaid a Relief International - Microfinance Iraq loan, which she used to purchase a new sewing machine and some quality fabrics. 

To continue improving the services she can offer to her customers and to also improve her work conditions, she took out a new loan to purchase an iron and redesign her work area. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor; thereby, they are unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. The groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: To purchase an iron and redesign her work area

loans.name: Jenny Del Rocio

texts.es: Jenny de 37 años vive en Isla Trinitaria sector sur urbano de Guayaquil. Hace 4 años atrás empezó la venta de ropa, lo hizo porque le gusta trabajar y este tipo de negocios es factible porque el mismo controla su tiempo de trabajo. El trabajo lo realiza haciendo sus recorridos por varios sectores ofertando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Ofrece sabanas a $ 30.00 dólares, blusas a $ 14.00, pantalones jeans $ 28.00 cremas a $ 6.00 perfumes $ 20.00 labiales $ 5.00 tiene un margen bastante aceptable que le permite cubrir sus costos y gastos. Su esposo es chofer profesional y se dedica a realizar carreras a personas particulares. Sus hijos tienen 12, 10 y 14 años asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar mercadería para tener en stock ya que le gustaría mantener su negocio para en un futuro adecuar un local en su domicilio
texts.en:
Jenny, 37, lives in Isla Trinitaria, located in the southern section of the city of Guayaquil. Four years ago, she began selling clothing because she liked a job that made it possible to plan her work schedule. She makes her rounds of different neighborhoods from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. She sells sheets for $30.00 dollars, blouses for $14.00, jeans for $28.00, creams for $6.00, perfumes for $20.00, and lipsticks for $5.00. Her gross margin allows her to cover her costs and expenses. 

Her husband is a chauffeur who drives for specific clients. Her children are 12, 10, and 14 years old and attend public school.She will buy more stock with the loan; someday she would like to have a space in her home for her business.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, perfumes, and makeup.

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April is a returning Accion Texas client who has steadily grown a successful small business built around her passion: sewing and fabrics. 

Before launching an entrepreneurial career, she was employed by a major fabric store in her hometown of Austin, Texas. A sewing enthusiast, the 33-year-old said she couldn't sew with the kind of high-end, designer fabrics she desired because they weren't locally available. She could only find the fabrics she wanted when she traveled around the country and abroad. So she took matters into her own hands and started a business that filled a void in the Austin market: offering high-end, quality fabrics from around the world at affordable prices. 

"I never really wanted to be an entrepreneur," April said. "I just wanted a store like this to open in town and I knew no one else would do it." She then opened The Fabricker, where she offers inventory from a variety of vendors who purchase their fabric from both famous and lesser-known local designers. 

This is not how she originally envisioned her new entrepreneurial career, however. 

With the encouragement of a friend who had launched a successful business with an Accion Texas Inc. loan, she applied and was approved for her own Accion loan to create an at-home business where she would sell fabric – while still working full time. Then she got laid off. Combining the Accion loan with her severance package allowed her to follow her dream and open the store. 

April was always entrepreneurial, however. Before losing her job, she sold fabric at craft shows and out of her home, gaining a loyal clientele. She always managed to find excellent fabric from around the world because when her husband's job sends him out of the U.S., she sends him with a fabric budget. 

She chooses fabric first by its look, then feel. "If it's nice to the touch, if it's something I can see myself wearing, I'll buy it. But if I look at it and the print is nice, but cheaply made, I don't get it," she said. 

April recently took out a second Accion loan. It is being used to purchase new inventory and market her business with a new outdoor sign above the entrance to the store and ads in neighborhood newsletters. 

Though she currently works alone, April plans to eventually hire employees. "Being my own boss is probably the hardest job ever, and I have kids," April said." There's no one to give you answers. You need a mentor. It can be very lonely and scary, but luckily, many people have reached out to help me," she said. 

Find out more about her store and view her fabrics on her Tumbler and Facebook pages at: www.fabricker.com and https://www.facebook.com/fabricker.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory and market her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew and improve her work area.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is engaged in the furniture-making business. She is 42 years old and married to Charlie, who helps her manage their small business. They were blessed with two children, Allan and Karen. They live simply in Allinguigan, 3rd province of Isabela.
Teresita and her husband started their business 15 years ago and they are now generating a monthly income of PHP 2,000. She says her success in this business is a result of patience and her positive attitude. To further improve her business, she would requests a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy wood and other materials needed in making furniture. This amount will be of great help in pursuing her business and generating more income. She is hoping that someday her children will finish their studies thanks to this small enterprise.
Teresita is happy that her family has a harmonious relationship. In this way, she is always inspired to work hard.

loans.use: to buy wood for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is a 58-year-old married woman. She has seven grown-up children. She describes herself as patient, quiet, and responsible. She is a vegetable vendor in the community. She has been involved in this business for ten years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be loss of products due to the perishable nature of her goods. She will use the P10,000 loan to add to her stock of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbage. She hopes that within five years, she will be able to educate her children to high levels of education.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and cabbage for her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is married with 10 children. She is 60 years old and lives in the province of Isabela. For the past 10 years, she has been raising pigs to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more pigs. Viloeta is well-known in her community as a responsible and very patient mother. In the future, she hopes to increase her earnings from pig raising so that her total net income is 50,000 PHP.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is from the village of Burgos. She is 55 years old. She is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics and apparel products from AVON and Natasha Company in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years. 

Erlinda is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as clothes, pants, and make-up. Erlinda's goal is to continue working and increase her profits so that she can have a good life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
When Tony was preparing to open his massage therapy business in Caruthersville, Missouri, a town of 7,500, he received lots of negative feedback. Several people said he'd fail. But he has proven the naysayers wrong, celebrating his fourth anniversary this year. 

Before starting Caring Caress & Massage Wellness LLC, Tony, 47, worked many jobs and gained extensive experience in marketing and health care. Being an entrepreneur was always one of his dreams, so when he decided he wanted both a career change and to become his own boss, he chose the growing field of massage therapy, eventually earning his certification from High-Tech Institute, which is now Anthem College in Memphis, Tenn. 

Caring Caress & Massage Wellness LLC offers foot and deep tissue massages, colon hydrotherapy, and creates client information brochures on the benefits of massage therapy. Tony's business also works with the American Cancer Society by donating money and volunteering in the Relay for Life to raise cancer research funds. 

He is currently the only massage therapist in his studio, but he plans to hire another to assist him and expand the business. He presently employs a licensed colon hydrotherapist and a person who does manicures and pedicures. And he wants to eventually hire a chiropractor. 

Early in his new career as an entrepreneur, Tony attended a seminar where he found out about Accion Texas. He kept up with Accion via emails, and when he found about the grand opening of an office in his area, he decided to apply for a loan. He was approved and the loan proceeds will allow him to buy equipment and supplies, such as the Steamy Wonder TM. This product is essentially a portable sauna and helps clients detoxify and lose weight without body wraps. Tony also plans to purchase and sell a line of home-use wellness products in his studio. 

Always eager to increase his knowledge and help people, Tony is an active member of the American Massage Therapy Association. Through this affiliation, he receives liability insurance that covers him anywhere he works, and receives discounted rates on educational classes and new products. "They do a ton of research and share that with us," Tony said. "And clients have found me through the organization's website. I wouldn't want to be without them." 

Tony also works health fairs, gives chair massages in offices, sells gift certificates and passes out marketing fliers – all with an eye toward growing his clientele and expanding his business. 

To learn more about Tony's company and services, visit the following sites: http://www.caringcaressmassageandwellness.com and http://www.facebook.com/caringcaress.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Ghamgin's Group

texts.en:
Ghamgin is a 25-year-old married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, she is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She has three years experience in the small business activity and she is hoping that through small improvements she can create better opportunities. 

She took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to renovate and redesign her work area as a step towards providing her customers with better quality service. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor-therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to renovate her work area

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married and is a loving mother to her children. She is a well-mannered and conscientious person. She has been involved in fattening pigs for over three years. Her husband helps her with this business, and looks after and feeds the livestock when she goes to the market to buy more livestock. She wants to expand her business and maximize her profits in order to provide for her family and place her children in schools.

 Rosalia wants to obtain a loan in the sum of P10,000 for the purchase of feed and vitamins and increasing turnover. She is grateful to all creditors for their help and mercy.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, 55, lives in the town of Naguilan, province of Isabela. 

Elenita works hard to support the needs of her children. Her husband is farmer, and they help each other to achieve their dream for their children. 

Elenita is a vegetable vendor. She is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy different vegetables that she can sell in the community. She dreams that someday she will have her own store and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbage, squash, and beans for her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 60 years old and she is married with ten children. She lives and works in Naguilan, a semi-urban area in Isabela province, with one dependent. Lolita has a grocery business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase different products like sugar, canned goods and snack foods to sell. Lolita has been involved in this business for ten years. The main hardship that Lolita faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demands for products. With her business profit, Lolita hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and sugar to sell in her store

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en: Malyn is from the village of Burgos. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Malyn owns and operates a business venture providing a tricycle transport service in the local community. Malyn is a very hardworking mother. She makes sure that she can meet the needs of her family. Malyn is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy spare parts needed for her transportation business so that she can better serve her clients. Malyn hopes that her business expands so that she can give the quality of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts needed for her tarnsportation business

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es:
Aditza sigue con su comercio, de venta de ropa interior para dama, hombre y niño, trabajo que hace dia a dia, vendiendo ambulante y en su casa, tiene el apoyo moral y economico de su esposo quien labora en servicios de seguridad, hoy en dia, da estudio al menor.
Sus ventas han sido sastifactorias, al introducir mercaderia variada, ya que con los financiamiento ha logrado el objetivo. Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: tres docenas de viquines para dama, tres docenas de boxer para varon, una docena buzo de mujer,calcetinez, camisa de varon, toallas, cartera de mano de hombre, entre otros articulos que son demandados por los clientes.Mejorando sus ventas al ofrecer mas ropa.
texts.en: Aditza continues with her business of selling undergarments for women, men, and children. She does this work every day as a street vendor. In her home, she has the moral and economic support of her husband, who works in security services. Today, she provides an education for their youngest child. By introducing varied merchandise, her sales have been satisfactory. It is because of funding that she has achieved this goal. With this new loan she will buy three dozen ladies bikinis, three dozen men's boxer shorts, a dozen women's sweatshirts, socks, men's shirts, towels, and a men's handbag, among other items that are in demand by the customers. Her sales are improving as she offers more clothes.

loans.use: to buy undergarments for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Maria Elsa, sigue elaborando  espejos y cuadros muy buenos y bonitos, trabajo que hace desde hace nueve años, y que ha venido trabajando con financiamiento, ya que soy muy demandado por los clientes, vendiendo al contado y al credito.
comprara materiales en yeso, pintura, pinzel, madera,lija,esmalte entre otros.
Para ella el producir mas productos, es obtener mejores ganancias, en donde distribuye en pago de trabajadores, pago de alimentacion, servicios de agua, luz, y sus compromisos de pago, siendo madre soltera y que hasta ahora logro apoyar  a sus hijos mayores. Y que junto a Afodenic ha sido posible estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Maria Elsa continues to produce well-made, beautiful mirrors and frames, work she has been doing for nine years with the financing to meet high demand from her clients, to whom she sells on cash and credit. She will buy plaster, paint, brushes, wood, sandpaper, varnish, and other supplies.

For Maria Elsa, producing more products means higher profits to pay workers, buy food, pay her utilities, and make her loan payments, while being a single mother who has even managed to help her older children financially. Working with Afodenic has made these achievements possible.

loans.use: to buy plaster, paint, wood, and other materials to make mirrors and frames.

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 29-year-old Iraqi woman who is married and has two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwin is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. 

With six years experience in small business, Parwin had looked for opportunities in the past to improve the services she offered. She took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq which she used to purchase a small generator, allowing her to work during the many hours when electricity is not available in her city; she also bought some nice quality fabric. After the successful repayment of that loan, she is now taking a loan to expand the services offered to her customers. She is buying an over (finishing) machine and an embroidery machine to be able to provide her customers with a greater variety of custom made items. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor--thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an over machine and an embroidery machine

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is already 49 years old and is married to Agapito, a 50-year-old farmer. They have four children, three of whom are still studying. Their eldest is George, Jay-Jay, and following him is Jerome. Mercedes is praying that all her children will finish their studies someday through their business, which they are trying to improve more. Mercedes, along with her husband, runs a furniture business. They are helping each other in making and selling their products. Their children have growing needs which is the reason why they need to double their effort in producing more products. 

The couple needs additional revolving capital to finance the needs of their business. Mercedes is requesting to borrow a loan of 15,000 PHP. They need to purchase more wood so that they will be able to produce more furniture in a short period of time. She hopes that her proposal will be approved because it will be of great help to the success of their business which could also assists the educational needs of their children.

loans.use: to buy wood and other materials needed in her furniture business

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is a businesswoman who has a small grocery store where she sells basic daily needs such as canned goods, shampoo, spices, body creams and other products. She has benefited from prior loans, which she invested in her business. The current loan that she is requesting is to purchase basic grains such as rice, sugar, canned goods, snack foods, and candies to sell. In addition, she will buy cosmetics such as lotions, creams and shampoo. Her husband and children help her tend to the business after they arrive home from school.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, canned good, snack foods, and candies for her store

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn (pictured above) is 49 years old and her husband, Roem, is 52 years old. They have been married since 1985. They have one daughter who is married and still lives in the family home and one daughter who works for a bakery. The family lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

In the local market, Sokhorn sells fruit and fish that her husband catches. Her husband is a fisherman. Because he has to paddle his boat which is difficult for him, he spends a lot of time moving his boat to other places and he can’t get back home in time to sell the fish he caught. Hence, Sokhorn decides to request a loan in the amount of 700 USD to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying a boat motor and repair the boat.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying a boat motor and repair the boat.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est mariée et mère de  04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 37 ans et le moins âgé a 27 ans. Elle n'a personne à charge. Elle vend des galettes et des noix de palme depuis des années. Cécile s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Cécile veut acheter de l'huile et des sacs d'arachide. Cécile avec ses économies veut participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne également de développer son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: Cécile is married and mother to 04 children. The oldest is 37 years old and the youngest is 27 years old. None of them are in her care. She has been selling flat cakes and palm nuts for years. Cécile gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. Cécile wants to buy oil and bags of peanuts. With her savings, Cécile would like to contribute to the education of her children. She also hopes to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy one 25 litre can of oil and 10 bags of peanuts

loans.name: Adeline Noël

texts.fr: Adeline Noël est une femme mariée de 30 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 12 ans, elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 3 ans déjà ou elle tient une épicerie dans laquelle elle commercialise la tomate, les épices et le poisson. Elle aimera augmenter son capital pour mieux d'approvisionner en achetant les cajots de tomate pour détailler à ses clients, ainsi que  trois cartons de maquereaux parce que c'est le poisson le plus consommé dans son secteur. cela lui permettra d'augmenter ses ventes et de réaliser un plus gros bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie dans son activité en achetant plus de poisson parce qu'elle aimera ouvrir une poissonnerie dans un futur proche. Le reste l'aidera pour les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adeline Noël is a 30 year old married woman, a mother of 4 children whose ages vary between 2 and 12 years of age. She is a trader in a market in the capital city, and for three years now she has had a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, spices and fish.
She wants to increase her working capital to better purchase her stock, by buying crates of tomatoes to retail in smaller quantities to her customers, and also three boxes of mackerel - as this is the most popular fish in the region.
This will allow her to increase her sales and to make a larger profit. She will invest part of this in the business, buying more fish as she hopes to open a fishmongers shop in the near future. The balance of the money will help her to fund her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of fish and some crates of tomatoes

loans.name: Elizabeth Ignacia

texts.es: Elizabeth de 31 años continua gustándole todo lo referente a la belleza, es por ese motivo que empezó haciendo manicura a sus familiares y amigas. De eso han pasado 4 años en los cuales a realizado varios cursos aprendiendo nuevas técnicas de manicura, cuidado capilar, corte y estilo. Ahora tiene en su domicilio un ambiente apropiado donde realiza la labor para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita Elizabeth con el primero adecuado el lugar para el salón de belleza, compro un sillón,  secadora y plancha para el cabello. Con estas herramientas brinda servicios como tinturados, alisados, corte y cuidado de manos y pies, de momento está manejando sola el negocio pero espera contratar una ayudante a futuro.
