Silvio continues working in a gas station as an attendant every 24 hours.  His wife cares for their three children.  For him, making home improvements is of great importance and he’s been making these improvements with each loan cycle Afodenic continues to grant him.

With this new loan today he will replace the roof and will plaster leading to better hygiene and comfort for his family.  He will buy supplies like sand, cement, gravel, metal sheets, wood beams and nails to start the project.

loans.use: to plaster and to replace the kitchen's roof.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: Don Timoteo de 53 años de edad,tiene bajo su responsabilidad a cuatro hijos,de los cuales 3 estan estudiando actualmente,el se dedica desde hace 10 años al cultivo de ejote frances y al cultivo de frijol de suelo, maiz, café.y otros vejetales, por la calidad de su productos sus clientes ban a comprarlo al lugar donde el cultiva,de esta fuente es que don timoteo abtiene recursos para darles estudio a sus hijos,el le da gracias a Dios porque gracias a los credito que Kiva le a otorgado a podido ir creciendo en su cultivo,les agradese la confianza que le han depositado a su persona, el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de quimico organico para abonar su cultivo, y tambien para la compra de cajas plasticas para poder transportar su producto,espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Don Timoteo is 53 years old and is responsible for four children, three of whom are currently studying. For the past 10 years, he has been growing French-style green beans (haricot verts) on his land as well as corn, coffee, and other vegetables. His customers buy his products in quantity directly from his farm. This source of income is how Don Timoteo is able pay for his children’s education. He gives thanks to God for being able to obtain a Kiva loan so that he can continue growing his crops. In addition, he appreciates the trust that has been demonstrated to him as a person.

Timoteo will buy chemicals and organic matter for fertilizing his crops. He will also purchase plastic crates so that he can transport his products. Timoteo hopes the loan he requested will be helpful.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and to acquire plastic crates for transporting his products.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy empeñosa. Su pareja es Rony, quien es el padre de sus seis hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su motivación. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja.

Su actividad es la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros artículos de uso personal. Su mercadería la compra en los centros comerciales de su localidad y los vende en los caseríos ubicados a la rivera de los ríos, realizando viajes periódicos a esa zona. Empezó con este negocio hace 4  años, con un capital propio, luego fue creciendo con préstamos de MFP y con el apoyo de su pareja, trabajan juntos. Le gusta su actividad porque que la mantiene ocupada y le permite visitar a su madre que vive en uno de los caserío que visita. Pero comenta que es un negocio con bastante desgaste físico y no le permite estar el tiempo suficiente con sus hijos. Por eso desea incursionar en otro que pueda realizar en su casa, como una tienda de comestibles.

Este es el préstamo número 8 que tiene con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio. Por tal motivo, se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los créditos anteriores. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de mercadería variada (linternas, pilas, ropa, productos de belleza y otros) para seguir con su actual negocio.
texts.en:
Celia, 41, is a hardworking, very enterprising woman.  Her partner is Rony who is the father of their six children who she loves very much and are her motivators.  They live together in their own house that she managed to build with support from her spouse.

Her activity is selling clothes, shoes and other personal use items.  She buys her merchandise in local shopping centers and sells them in hamlets located along the river banks making periodic trips to these areas.  

She started the business four years ago with her own capital and then grew with MFP loans and with support from her spouse; they work together.  She likes her activity because she keeps busy and she’s able to visit her mother who lives in one of the hamlets she visits.  But she comments that it’s a business that’s very demanding physically and keeps her from spending much time with her children which is why she’d like to go into some other type of business like a grocery store that she can do from home.

This is MFP loan #8 and she feels grateful for the financial support she’s been getting to advance with her business.  Because of this she commits to be responsible with her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans.  On the other hand, she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers its members to be responsible people.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy assorted merchandise (flashlights, batteries, clothes, beauty products and others) to continue with her current business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Getulio

texts.es:
Getulio tiene 37 años, es un hombre trabajador, alegre y con ganas de superación. Viven con sus dos hijos (Getulio de 21 y Eder de 19 años de edad) y su madre.
Su actividad es la venta ambulatoria de golosinas y plátanos fritos conocidos como “chifles”. También alquila su motocarro para generarse un ingreso adicional. Las golosinas y los plátanos fritos los elabora en su casa con la ayuda de sus hijos y los lleva a vender caminando por los diferentes barrios de la ciudad. Decidió iniciar este negocio hace más de 4 años, tiempo que le valió para lograr crecer y hacerse conocido. Considera rentable a esta actividad porque es fácil de realizar y por las buenas ganancias que le deja, además le gusta socializar y hacer amistades. Su deseo es crecer y producir en mayor volumen para vender, al por mayor, a las bodegas.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Es así que se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen record crediticio porque quiere acceder a otros créditos más adelante.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de gran variedad de golosinas y platanitos fritos, preparándose para las fiestas locales del mes de junio. También desea comprar un motor nuevo para su motocarro valorizado en 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Getulio, 37, is a hardworking, cheerful man who very much wants to get ahead.  He lives with his two sons, Getulio, 21, and Eder, 19, and with his mother.

He is a street vendor.  He sells snacks and fried plantain known as “chifles.”  He also leases out his car to earn additional income.  He makes the snacks and fried plantain at home with help from his sons and goes out walking throughout the various neighborhoods in his city to sell them.  He decided to start this business over four years ago and this time has served for him to grow and become well-known.  He considers his work to be profitable because it’s easy to do and it generates good profits; besides he enjoys socializing and making friendships.  His desire is to grow and produce in larger volumes to sell to stores at wholesale.

This is his first MFP loan and he hopes to continue towards his objectives.  He commits to be responsible with his installment payments to have a good credit history because he wants to access more loans later on.

He will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy ingredients to make the wide variety of snacks and fried plantains to get ready for the June festivals.  He also wants to buy a new engine for his vehicle that costs 600 new soles.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Rosenda tiene 66 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Está separada del padre de sus cuatro hijos. Vive en compañía de dos de ellos; Elva de 34 años y Benjamín de 27 años, en su casa propia, la que compró con mucho esfuerzo.
Su negocio es el alquiler de su motocarro para el uso de transporte de pasajeros. Lo hace desde hace 7 años y lo considera muy rentable porque recibe ganancias diarias. Lo que le gusta es que puede manejar sus tiempos, ya que en la mañana trabaja como docente en un colegio de su localidad, a medio tiempo. Pero inició su negocio para tener ingresos económicos adicionales, ya que su sueldo no le alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Ahora se siente más tranquila y cómoda, ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Sus planes a futuro son de implementar una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda.

Este es su préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP.  Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores y tener un buen record crediticio.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro, comprando un motor nuevo valorizado en 600 nuevos soles, además de repuestos para tener operativo su vehículo.
texts.en:
Rosenda, 66, is a hardworking woman who has a strong desire to succeed.  She is separated from the father of her four children.  She lives in her own home, which she bought with a lot of effort, with two of her children: Elva, 34, and Benjamin, 27. 

Rosenda has a business renting out a moto-taxi that is used to transport passengers.  She has been doing this for 7 years, and she considers this business to be very profitable because she receives daily earnings from it.  What she likes about this business is that she can organize her time, because in the mornings she is a teacher who works in a local school on a part-time basis.  She started her business to have some additional income, because her salary was not sufficient to cover all of the expenses of her children.  Now she feels more tranquil and comfortable, because she has a regular income and has more free time.  In the future, she plans to set up a grocery store in her house.

This is her 14th loan from MFP, and she is committed to making her payments as she did with her previous loans so that she can maintain a good credit record.  With the sum of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will invest in some maintenance work on her moto-taxi, buying a new motor valued at 600 soles and some spare parts to keep her vehicle operating.

loans.use: to buy a motor and some parts for her moto-taxi

loans.name: Bassangou Kheweul Group

texts.fr:
Bassangou  Khewel  est un groupement féminin composé de 5 membres et est situé à environ quelques kilomètres de la caisse, ce groupement s’active dans le commerce (vente de friperie, de produits alimentaires et non alimentaires, d’aliments de bétail).IL est dirigé par sa présidente Mme Ouleye âgée de 58 ans mariée et mère de famille.
Mme Ouleye s’active dans  le commerce  depuis  15 ans, elle achète ses marchandises à Dakar pour ensuite les revendre, elle a aménagé une place chez elle.
Mme Oulèye roule avec un stock de 150 000 et  gagne au moins 25 000 le mois, de ce fait elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 pour  acheter de la friperie, des savons, des produits cosmétiques  et d’huile de palme, pour avoir un bénéfice plus important qui lui permettra de faire face aux charges personnelles. Mme Oulèye veut un jour avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Bassangou Khewel is a group  composed of five women and  based just a few kilometers from the credit institution's branch. The group members work as vendors (used clothing, food products and other items, animal feed). The group is  organized by its chair, Mrs. Ouleye, who is 58 years old and married, with children.

Mrs. Ouley has been working as a vendor for 15 years. She buys her goods in Dakar in order to resell them out of her home.
Mrs. Ouley has a working capital of 150,000 West African francs and earns at least 25,000 francs per month. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 in order to buy used clothing, soap, cosmetics, and palm oil, in order to earn higher revenues and provide for her personal needs. One day she would like to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, palm oil, soap and cosmetics.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 30 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su pareja es Kevin, quien es el padre de sus tres hijos: Kevin de 9 años, Arison de 2 años y Adriana de 4 meses de nacida.  Viven en la casa que logró construir junto con su pareja.

Su negocio es la venta de comestibles y abarrotes en general. Tiene una pequeña bodega que logró acondicionar en su vivienda, notando la necesidad de sus vecinos de adquirir sus productos en un lugar más cercano. Lleva ya 7 meses, tiempo en el que logró hacerse conocida y ganar una regular clientela. Hasta el momento lo viene realizando con la ayuda de su pareja, en sus ratos libres, para la atención. Le gusta su actividad por poder estar en casa y atender a sus menores hijos, este fue el principal motivo por el cual se decidió a abrir una bodega en casa, ya que anteriormente trabajaba en un puesto de ventas en el mercado.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que se siente contenta de la oportunidad brindada para poder contar con un capital de trabajo, y como desea seguir contando con este apoyo, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, comprará mayor variedad de comestibles y abarrotes, buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera aumentará su stock de mercadería.
texts.en:
Nilda, 30, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman.  Her spouse is Kevin who is the father of their three children: Kevin, 9, Arison, 2, and Adriana, 4-months-old.  They live in the house she managed to build with her spouse.

Her business is selling food and groceries in general.  She has a small store she managed to set up at home noting the need her neighbors had of acquiring products in a closer location.  She’s been open for 7 months and has become known and established a clientele in that time.  To date, she’s been working with help from her spouse who helps her in his free time to tend to customers.  She likes this activity because she’s able to stay home and care for her minor children; this was the main reason why she decided to open a store at home since she used to work in a sales stand in the market.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s happy about the support provided in order to have working capital and since she wants to continue with this business she commits to be punctual with her payments.  She’s also happy in her communal bank because of the support they give each other.

She will use the requested 1800 new soles to buy a larger variety of food items and groceries seeking out low prices for volume purchases thus increasing her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Yuvis

texts.es:
Yuvis tiene 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, además de amable y cordial. Su pareja es Enrique, quien se dedica al transporte y es el padre de su hijo Jhesci, de 13 años. 
Su actividad es la compra de motos y motocarros usados, los repara y los vende a precios más altos. Inició este negocio hace más de 3 años por idea de su pareja, juntos trabajan en el taller que implementaron en su vivienda. Adicionalmente, tiene un empleo de medio tiempo en una empresa de su localidad, pero ese sueldo no le era suficiente, ahora con este negocio pueden solventar todos los gastos de la familia. Tiene planes de seguir creciendo hasta tener una tienda para la venta de motos.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, por lo que está contenta y agradecida de saber que seguirá contando con una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 4000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de un motocarro usado valorizado en 3800 nuevos soles, además de los repuestos para su reparación.
texts.en:
Yuvis, 30, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being nice and kind.  Her spouse is Enrique who works in transportation and is the father of their son, Jhesci, 13.

Her activity is buying and selling used motorcycles and cars.  She repairs them and then sells them at higher prices.  She started the business more than three years ago; it was her spouse’s idea.  They work together in the shop they set up at home.  In addition, she has a part-time job at a local firm but this salary is insufficient.  With this business they are now able to cover family expenses.  She plans to continue growing and eventually have a motorcycle sales store.

This is MFP loan #6.  She is happy and grateful to know that she will continue to have a line of credit to advance with her business.  She commits to make her payments like she’s done in the past.

She will use the requested 4000 new soles to buy a used car that costs 3800 new soles as well as spare parts to repair it.

loans.use: to buy a used vehicle and spare parts for it to repair and resell it.

loans.name: Cicilio

texts.es:
Cicilio tiene 54 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre. Está casado con Sirila, la madre de sus cuatro hijos. Ahora solo viven con dos de ellos; Juan de 32 y Luís de 16 años.
Tienen una tienda de comestibles en su casa, la cual atiende su esposa. Pero también cuenta con un motocarro desde hace 10 años con el que realiza servicio de transporte de pasajeros en sus ratos libres. La bodega la tienen hace más de un año, tiempo que le valió para crecer y ampliar, llegando a tener muchos clientes, en su mayoría a vecinos, y hasta el momento cuenta con la compañía y ayuda de su esposa en la atención. Anteriormente tenía un puesto de venta en el mercado, pero le resulto muy cansado la rutina, decidiendo cambiar y abrir un negocio en la comodidad de su casa para que pueda descansar. Le gusta su actividad, porque puede conocer a sus vecinos y hacer amistades, además de los ingresos económicos con los cuales cubre los gastos de su hogar. Ahora tiene pensado comprar un teléfono público para brindar ese servicio a sus vecinos y tener más ingresos económicos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está contento de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio y concretar sus planes de negocio. Por tanto, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas como en el crédito anterior.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1800 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de un teléfono publico valorizado en 1200, con lo restante adquirirá más abarrotes para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Cicilio is 54 years old. He is a very hardworking and cheerful man. He is married to Sirila, the mother of his four children. Now they only live with two of them: Juan, who is 32 years old, and Luis, who is 16.

They have a food shop in their house, tended by his wife. They also have had a "motocarro" [a three-wheeled van] for ten years, with which they provide a low-cost passenger transportation service. 

They have had the shop for more than one year; they've used this time to grow and increase their stock. They now have many customers, the majority of whom are their neighbors, and so far Cicilio has had the help and company of his wife in running the store. Before, he had a stall in the market, but he found the routine very tiring. He decided to make a change and open a business in the comfort of their own house so they could rest. They like this business, because they can get to know their neighbors and make friends; in addition, they use the economic income to cover household costs. Now, Cicilio is planning to buy a public telephone so he can offer that service to his neighbors and have more income.

This is the second loan with the institution MFP; Cicilio is happy to know that he continues to have financial support to move forward with his business and make his business plans a reality. He is committed to making his loan payments as he did with the previous loan. 

With the amount requested—1,800 nuevos soles (PEN)—Cicilio will invest in the purchase of a public telephone worth 1200 PEN; with the rest, he will buy more groceries to stock his shop.

loans.use: to purchase a public telephone and stock up his store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 54 años, es una mujer con muchas ansias de progresar, además de ser alegre y sociable. Su pareja es Ramiro, quien es maestro de construcción civil, y el padre de sus dos hijos. Vive en su casa propia, la que construyó en el terreno que compró años atrás, en compañía de su hija y sus dos nietos.

Ella se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, tiene 10, las que instaló en la parte de atrás de su vivienda, cobrando 100 nuevos soles por cada una. Empezó hace más de 5 años con un capital propio, logrando hacer crecer su negocio de a pocos, y el tiempo le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida. Esto le permite tener un ingreso económico regular para el sostén de su familia y poder pagar los estudios de sus nietos. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y está agradecida al saber que seguirá contando con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por tanto, se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como lo fue anteriormente.

Con el préstamo solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de construcción (fierros, tubos, clavos y demás) y pagará la mano de obra para construir más habitaciones y así poder recibir más inquilinos.
texts.en:
Alicia, 54, is a woman who very much wants to make progress; she’s cheerful and sociable too.  Her spouse is Ramiro who is a master builder and the father of their two children.  She lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in her own house that she built on a lot she bought years ago.

She rents rooms; she has ten that she built in the back of her house.  He charges 100 new soles for each one.  She started over five years ago with capital of her own and gradually her business grew.  This time has served for her to become well-known which makes it possible for her to have regular income to support her family and pay for her grandchildren’s schooling.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s grateful to know that she will continue to have financial support to advance her business.  She, therefore, commits to be responsible with her payments like she’s been so far.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy building materials and supplies (rebar, tubes, nails and others) and will pay labor costs to build more rooms and be able to have more tenants.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married mother of 5 children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Lydia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Charlenia

texts.es:
Charlenia tiene 25 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre, muy dinámica y deseosa de progresar.  Su pareja es José, quien se dedica al transporte. No tienen hijos y por el momento viven en la casa de sus suegros.
Su actividad es la venta de comida rápida (salchichas con pollo, pollos frito y otros típicos de la región) y gaseosas. Para esto instala una mesa en el frontis de su vivienda donde atiende a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Esta labor la empieza por la tarde, con todos los preparados de sus comidas, ya que por la mañana trabaja como docente en un colegio de su localidad. Esta contenta porque con este negocio puede tener un ingreso económico adicional a su sueldo mensual como profesora, con lo que puede solventar todos los gastos de su familia. El problema es que termina muy cansada por todo el trabajo del día, pero a pesar de eso desea continuar con su negocio hasta lograr tener un local donde atender a sus clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP. Comenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de utensilios para su negocio (ollas, platos, vasos), además de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Charlenia, 25, is a hardworking, cheerful, very dynamic woman who very much wants to make progress.  Her spouse is José who works in transportation.  They have no children and for the moment are living in her in-laws’ house.

Her activity is selling fast-food (sausages with chicken, fried chicken and others typical of the region) and soft-drinks.  To do so she sets up a table in front of her house where she tends to her customers who for the most part are her neighbors.  She starts her work in the afternoon preparing her dishes because she works mornings as a teacher at a local school.  She is happy because with this business she’s able to earn income in addition to her monthly teacher’s salary that she can use to cover all her family’s expenses.  The problem is that she ends up very tired after all the day’s work but despite this she wants to continue with her business until she can have a locale where she can take care of her customers.

This is her first MFP loan.  She comments that she’s grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to reach her goals.  She, therefore, commits to make her installment payments.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy utensils (pots, dishes, glasses) for her business as well as ingredients and supplies to make her food.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and food-making ingredients.

loans.name: Entrada A Chunazaca  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Entrada a Chunazana está formado por 12 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por el cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene accidentada geografía la cual le da un clima frió y grandes extensiones para disfrutar de la naturaleza fuera de la rutina de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades económicas las que les permiten mejorar la economía de sus hogares, su gente aun mantienen la vestimenta, la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son amables, gentiles y de un corazón muy cálido.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Lidia Rocio, tiene 21 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 5 años de edad quien ingresara este año a la escuela. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa es de su propiedad construida con el trabajo conyugal.

La Señora Lidia Rocio se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de su hijo, como pasa en casa aprovecha el tiempo para dedicarse a la agricultura, ella siembra hortalizas las mismas que vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad de Cuenca, también cría y vende cerdos y gallinas, en estas actividades se encuentra hace 7 años.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, semillas y también llantas para un vehículo de su propiedad.

Su meta es tener un negocio más estable como una tienda.
texts.en:
Entrada a Chunazaca Communal Bank is made up of 12 women and 1 man who live in Nabón Canton, a place of rugged geography with a cold climate and large expanses for enjoying nature beyond the routine of the city.  The residents work raising animals and in agriculture, and many of them leave the city every day to do various types of work, which allows them to improve the household finances.  The people still preserve the dress, culture, and traditions of their communities.  They are pleasant, kind, and warm hearted.

One of the members of this group is Lidia Rocío, 21.  She is married and from this relationship has a five-year-old child who will begin school this year.  Her husband works in the construction field as a bricklayer.  Her house is her own property, built with her husband's labor.

Lidia Rocío works in the home and taking care of her son.  Since she is at home, she makes the most of the time to work in agriculture.  She grows vegetables that she sells in her community or in the city of Cuenca.  She also raises and sells pigs and chickens.  She has been doing this work for seven years.

She is on her second loan with the communal bank and she's going to invest it in buying manure, seeds, and also tires for a vehicle she owns.

Her goal is to have a more stable business, such as a store.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, and tires.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 71 years old, married, with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Salvacion has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase another computer.

Salvacion has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase another computer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 53 years old and married, with 6 children. With one child in school, Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 9 years.  She sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, noodles, snack foods, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell at her general store

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 29 years old and married.

Cristine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her business.

Cristine has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Cristine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell for her business

loans.name: Kary

texts.es:
Kary tiene 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Edson, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos: Kary de 12 años y Linda de 7 años, a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada.

Su actividad es la venta de comestibles variados, para eso cuenta con un espacio en su casa donde almacena su mercadería. Los productos los adquiere en los centros comerciales de la ciudad para luego llevarlos a caseríos a las riveras del río, por lo que realiza viajes periódicos. Se inició hace más de 2 años por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo su pareja para la compra de la mercadería y en la venta sus familiares residentes en los caseríos que visita. Viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea ampliar el negocio con la venta de ropa, además de los comestibles.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de comestibles y ropa, al por mayor, buscando los precios más bajos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Kary is 46 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Edson is her partner. They have two children they love very much, Kary, who is twelve years old, and Linda, who is seven years old. They live together in a rented house.

She sells a variety of groceries. She stores her merchandise in a room in her house. She acquires her products in shopping centers in the city and then takes them to the riverside communities along the banks of the river. She makes periodic trips to accomplish her goal. She began working this way over two years ago because she needed to earn money. Currently, her partner helps her to purchase her merchandise, and her relatives who live in the riverside communities she visits help her to make sales. As a result of the good results she is having, she wishes to increase her business by selling clothing in addition to groceries.

This is her second loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma], and she is grateful for its financial support in helping her to realize her plans. Additionally, she feels good about her communal bank since she knows the other members and considers them to be responsible and caring people.
She will invest the requested amount of 1000 PEN [$400] by purchasing groceries and clothing at wholesale prices. She will look for the lowest prices to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josh

texts.en:
Josh is 50 years old. He is married to Ruth, and they have four children, aged four to 12 years.  His wife is a business lady and contributes additional income to the family.

Josh has been selling eggs for two years, and he has a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to purchase more eggs for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to support his children.

This is the first loan with KADET LTD. His hopes and dreams are to grow his business to sustain his family.

loans.use: to buy  more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 50 years old and married, with 6 children.

He earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Efren is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for his livestock.

Efren has been raising livestock for 3 years, and he also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and raising chickens.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream:  to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for his livestock.

loans.name: Koem Sien

texts.en:
Koem Sien, a soldier, and his wife, Chamroeun, a cleaner, have been married since 1983 and have three sons. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Koem Sien is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 to help his son launch a business selling cell phones, Mp3 and Mp4 players, and installing cell phone application. He will use the money to purchase a computer desktop and buy cell phones for resale.

loans.use: to help  his son launch business selling cell phones, Mp3 and Mp4 players, and installing cell phone applications.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 50 years old and married with six children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling piglets in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets to sell.

Rosalie has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of piglets business for 16 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to sell

loans.name: Kulsaira

texts.ru:
Кулсайре 60 лет, вдова, имеет 6 детей. Кулсайра в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 25,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Кулсайры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 35 овец, 2,28 га земли с фасолью, продажа молока приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулсайра обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку удобрений и семян для посева.  Доходы от кредита Кулсайра будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kulsaira is 60 years old, a widow, with six children. As a main source of income for her family, for 35 years Kulsaira has been engaged in farming and raising livestock, having launched this business  with a starting capital of 25,000 KGS. Thanks to Kulsaira’s hard work, at present her farm includes three cows with calves, 35 sheep, 2.28 ha [about 5.6 acres] of land for growing beans. Milk sales bring in about 5,000 KGS per month.

In order to develop his business further, Kulsaira has turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for the planting season. Kulsaira plans to reinvest her revenues from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and married, with 2 children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Lilibeth has borrowed, and repaid, 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run the general store for 5 years, and she also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Lilibeth aspires to save enough money that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny (in the photo), 51, and her husband Tun, 58, a driver for a company, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1981 and have one son who is a cell phone repairman and two daughters who are garment workers.

Vanny is a housewife whose main sources of income are her husband and children’s salaries. Vanny’s son wants to supplement his salary by selling cell phones and Mp3 and Mp4 players and installing cell phone applications. She is therefore requesting a loan for $1,000 in order to help him purchase a computer desktop and cell phones for resale.

loans.use: to help her son to supplement his income by selling cell phones and Mp3 and Mp4 players and installing cell phone applications.

loans.name: Diodora

texts.en:
Diodora is 57 years old and married with seven children.

Diodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Diodora has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from selling clothing.

Diodora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Miguela works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear retail business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling firewood and plastic wares. Miguela is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Miguela has sustained her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 45 years old and married, with 3 children.

Pablita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her store.

Pablita has borrowed, and repaid, 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years, and she also earns an income from dressmaking.

Pablita aspires to save enough money that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell at her store

loans.name: Junay

texts.en:
Junay is 53 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Junay runs a coconut wine retail business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.
Junay has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the coconut wine retail business for eight years and also earns an income from food vending. Junay aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros tiene 20 años, es una mujer buena, perseverante y emprendedora. Su pareja desde hace un año es Paul, con quien tiene un bebe de 10 meses de nacido. Actualmente vive en una casa alquilada que paga con el dinero que obtiene a diario de su trabajo.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de buffet y organización de fiestas. Prepara tortas, postres y comidas, dependiendo del tipo de reunión. Lleva realizando este trabajo por cinco años, se inició ayudando a su madre en la misma actividad, ella fue su mejor maestra. Pudo iniciar su propio negocio hace 3 años y lo hace en compañía de su cónyuge. Le va muy bien y tiene planes de consolidar su sueño de tener un taller de repostería totalmente equipado en su casa. Es por eso que espera seguir trabajando para más adelante tener una pastelería.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/. 2000) comprará todo lo que necesita para implementar su negocio de repostería; como bases de torta, artículos decorativos, colorantes, moldes e ingredientes.
texts.en:
Milagros is 20-years-old and is good woman who is entrepreneurial and has a lot of perseverance.  Her partner of a year is Paul who she has a 10-month-old baby with.  She currently lives in a rented house that she pays for with the money she earns from her job. 

Milagros works providing party planning and buffet services.  She prepares cakes, desserts, and meals – depending on the type of gathering.  She has been doing this work for five years.  She began by helping her mother with the same work, her mother was her best teacher.  She was able to open her own business three years ago and she did so with her partner.  It is going very well for her and she plans to put into action her dream of having a cake-baking workshop in her house.  This is why she hopes to continue working so that in the future she can have a cake shop.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is thankful for the opportunity and confidence shown in her.  She commits to follow through with her payments in a punctual fashion and also is thankful to be a part of the communal bank she belongs to, as she has seen that the members are responsible and committed to each other.

With the amount she is requesting (2000 nuevos soles), she will buy everything she needs to begin her baking business, such as: cake boards, decorative tools, food colorings, pans, and ingredients.

loans.use: to buy tools for the cake decorating she does.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 43 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.
Cynthia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for seven years and also earns income from farming rice.
Cynthia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 47 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from fishing.
Juanita aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teodora is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
Teodora has been raising pigs for 21 years and also earns additional income from "nipa" making (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair). She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Urselina

texts.en:
Urselina is 49 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Urselina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.
Urselina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 3 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É militar e quadro do Ministério da Defesa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (janelas, portas, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa, subir de categoria para aumentar o seu salário, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir um meio de transporte para melhorar as condições de deslocação para o seu serviço.
texts.en:
Manuel is a widower and father to 3 children who all attend school. He does not financially support anyone else.
He is a soldier and a member of staff at the Ministry of Defense. With this loan he intends to buy building materials (windows, doors, cement, sand stone and other items) in order to continue building his home.
In the future he hopes to finish his house and rise in the ranks in order to increase his salary. Consequently, he promises to keep to his repayment schedule so that he can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge he faces is acquiring his own transport to improve the conditions in which he travels to his workplace.

loans.use: to buy building materials (windows, doors, cement, sand, stone and other items).

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 61 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Allen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Allen has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for 12 years and also earns an income from dressmaking.
Allen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadsalim

texts.en:
Mahmadsalim is a man who has much experience in business. For more than 20 years he has been busy with collective farming. He grows different kinds of vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions and others. He takes pleasure in his work and loves it very much – that’s why his harvest is of a high quality. 
Mahmadsalim is very kind and good-natured. His family loves him very much and helps him in his business. He has 11 children and a lovely wife. His sons and daughters help to grow and sell vegetables. His goods attract many customers at the market. He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new season. If you are able to help him he will be very happy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Casada e sem filhos, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É cabeleireira e faz curso de contabilidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua casa, concluir o seu curso, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de transporte para o seu material de compra para a sua obra.
texts.en:
Ana is married without children. She lives in her own  home and does not financially support anyone else.
She is a hairdresser and is also studying on an accounting course. With this loan she intends to buy building materials (cement, sand, stone, doors and other items) in order to continue building her home.
In the future she hopes to finish building her house and complete her course; consequently, she promises to adhere to her repayment schedule so that she can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge that she faces is due to her lack of transport for the products that she carries for her work.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, sand, stone, doors and other items).

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
Damaris tiene 42 años, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Su pareja es Bettman, el padre de sus tres hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia, la que logro construir con mucho esfuerzo con el apoyo de su pareja.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces variados, los cuales prepara en casa en un horno artesanal; luego los lleva, según pedido, a las bodegas y tiendas de comestibles de su zona y otros caseríos alejados de la ciudad. Realiza esta actividad hace más de 2 años, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos para la elaboración y reparto de los dulces, de esa manera logran acabar todos sus productos y dar mayor rotación a su capital. Le gusta su actividad, pues la mantiene ocupada, motivo por el que se decidió a empezar con este negocio, además de contar con un ingreso económico que le permita apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP, se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Y además, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues considera a sus compañeros personas solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá  en la compra de una amasadora de harina, traída desde la capital y valorizada en 2000 nuevos soles. Con lo restante adquirirá insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de los dulces.
texts.en:
Damaris is 42 years old. She is a woman with lots of business experience, and is also happy and kind. Her partner is Bettman. He is the father of her three children. They live together in their own house, which they managed to build together after putting out a lot of effort.

She makes and sells a variety of sweets which she prepares at home in a wood-fired brick oven. She then delivers them, according to her orders, to the corner stores and grocery stores in her area and in other riverside communities outside the city. She has been working this way for more than two years. Her children help her to make and distribute the sweets. This way they manage to sell all her products and turn over her capital quickly. She enjoys what she does, especially since it keeps her busy, which is one of the reasons she decided to start her business. She also wanted to have a source of income which would allow her to help her partner cover their living expenses and educate their children.

This is her fourth loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She is committed to making her loan payments on time, as she did with her previous loans. Additionally, she feels good about her communal bank since she considers the other members to be caring people.
She will invest the requested amount of 2500 PEN [$950] by purchasing a flour mixer, which she will bring from the capital and which is valued at 2000 PEN [$750]. She will use the rest of the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients to make sweets.

loans.use: to purchase a flour mixer and ingredients for her sweets.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de uma filha ainda menor de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É Mecânico, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleiras, cimento cola, areia, pedra, portas e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
No futuro deseja progredir profissionalmente e terminar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conseguir uma posição melhor no seu serviço para aumentar a sua renda mensal.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a married father with a young daughter. He lives in his own home and does not financially support anyone else.
He is a mechanic, and with this loan he intends to buy building materials (tiles, cement, glue, sand, stone, doors and other items) in order to continue building his home.
In the future he hopes to progress professionally and to finish building his house; consequently, he promises to adhere to his repayment schedule so that he can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge he faces is attaining a better position at work so that he can increase his monthly wage.

loans.use: to buy building materials (tiles, cement, glue, sand, stone, doors and other items).

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 24 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y decidida a salir adelante. Su pareja es Rony,  quien es comerciante y el padre de sus dos hijos: Rony de 4 años y Romina de 3. Juntos viven en la casa que les prestó un amigo mientas está de viaje.

Su negocio es la venta de madera, la cual compra de un aserradero y la almacena en su vivienda. Este negocio lo realiza con la ayuda de su pareja, con quien atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, principalmente los carpinteros de los alrededores. Inicio hace más de un año con un capital propio, comprando en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue aumentando al ver la demanda. Antes de empezar tenía dificultades económicas, ya que los gastos aumentaron con la llegada de sus hijos, pues ella tiene el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con ello para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando en su banco comunal apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.

Con el monto solicitado, de 1500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más madera para tener disponible para venta, ya que los precios están subiendo.
texts.en:
Lucila is 24 years old.  She is a hardworking woman who is determined to succeed.  Her partner is Rony, who works as a merchant.  He is the father of her two children: Rony, 4 years old, and Romina, 3 years old.  They live together in a house they are borrowing from a friend while he is on a trip.

Her business is selling wood, which she purchases from a sawmill and stores in her home.  She does this work with the help of her partner, who very kindly takes care of the customers, who are mainly local carpenters.  She started the business more than a year ago with her own money.  She began purchasing in small quantities and slowly increased the quantity upon seeing the demand.  Before starting the business, she had financial difficulties as expenses increased with the arrival of her children, but she wants to give them a better quality of life and a good education.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she counts on them to continue with her goals.  She likes the work that the community bank does to support people in moving forward with their businesses.

With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase more wood to have it available for sale, since prices are rising.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y con deseos de superación. Está separada del padre de sus tres hijos, pero tiene una nueva relación buscando rehacer su vida. Vive en compañía de su actual pareja y sus tres hijos, en su casa propia, la que construyó con su anterior pareja.

Su actividad es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, luego compró dos máquinas de coser para empezar su negocio, instalando su pequeño taller en su vivienda. Actualmente, ya cuenta con tres máquinas que fue comprando con sus ganancias y préstamos anteriores con MFP. Lleva realizando este oficio 4 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola. Le gusta hacer el oficio que tanto le gusta, con lo cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, quienes son  su mayor motivación para seguir esforzándose. El problema de este trabajo es tener que permanecer sentada en una misma postura, lo que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajando. Sus planes a futuro son de instalar un taller de confecciones mejor implementado en su casa.

Este es su préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea continuar con este apoyo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales de costura, especialmente para la confección de lencería (telas, hilos y otros).
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old. She is a very happy woman who hopes to get ahead in life. She is separated from the father of her three children, but she is looking to restart her life with her new relationship. She lives with her current partner and her three children in her own home, which she built with her previous partner.

She sews. She learned her trade by studying at a job training center, and then purchased two sewing machines to begin her business. Her little workshop is in her house. Currently, she has three sewing machines, which she purchased through her earnings and previous loans with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She has been working this way for four years, and she has been working by herself up to today. She likes working at a trade that she enjoys. Through her work she is able to cover her living costs and her children’s education. Her children are her biggest motivation to continue growing. Her work requires her stay seated in the same position, which sometimes causes her back to ache, but she does not get discouraged and continues working. Her future plans are to make a better equipped workshop in her house.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support she keeps receiving, and she hopes to continue receiving it. As a result, she is committed to making her loan payments on time, as she has done with previous loans.
She will invest the requested amount, 1000 PEN [$400] by purchasing sewing materials, specifically to make lingerie (fabric, thread, and other items).

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials to make lingerie.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pinto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos destes 3 vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mobília para a sua casa (mesa, cadeiras e outros) para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família.
No futuro deseja abrir uma serigrafia para aumentar a sua renda mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de transporte pessoal para conseguir ir e voltar do serviço sem dificuldades.
texts.en:
Pinto is a married father of 4 children, of whom 3 attend school. He lives in his own home and does not financially support anyone else.
He is a teacher and a member of staff at the Ministry of Education, and with this loan he intends to buy furniture for his home (table, chairs and other items) in order to offer his family greater comfort.
In the future he hopes to open a silk-screen printing business in order to increase his monthly income; consequently, he promises to adhere to the repayment schedule so that he can apply again to Hluvuku.
The biggest challenge he faces is his lack of personal transport which would make his journey to and from work easier.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his home (table, chairs and other items) to offer his family greater comfort.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 62 años, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Está casada con Jorge, quien es transportista y padre de su único hijo. Vive sólo con su pareja porque su hijo es independiente.

Su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Se inició por la recomendación de su amiga hace 5 años y desde entonces cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien siempre la transporta para la entrega y el cobro de los pedidos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, con lo cual puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Le gusta socializar y hacer nuevas amistades, así incrementa sus clientes. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos, el dinero que ganaba su esposo no alcanzaba para todos los gastos. Ahora tiene planes de instalar un local amplio en su casa donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza y bebidas.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, por eso cuenta con este apoyo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en su crédito anterior.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 62 years old, is an experienced woman when it comes to businesses. She is also a happy and kind woman. She is married to Jorge, who is a shipping carrier and the father of their only son. Her and her husband live by themselves now since their son is independent.

Mercedes sells beauty products through a catalogue. She began after a friend's recommendation five years ago and since then, she depends on her husband's help, who transports her so she can make deliveries and take orders. She considers her business to be fairly profitable due to the income she earns. With this income, she can help her husband with household expenses. She likes to sell and make new friends, which then increases her customer base. Before she started this business, she had many economic problems. The money that her husband earned was not sufficient to cover their expenses. Now she plans to set up a spacious shop in her home where she can sell her beauty products as well as drinks.

This is Mercedes's second loan with MFP, and she is counting on this help in order to continue with her goals. She also promises to be punctual in making her payments, just as she was with her previous loan.

With the requested sum, 2000 nuevo soles, she will invest in buying more beauty products and increase her stock.

loans.use: to increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Doña Rita Maria continua logrando su gran sueño, terminar su casa, junto a su esposa han hido avanzando en lo que mas pueden y con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo van saliendo adelante, con este nuevo financiamiento que le han otorgado ellos daran un ultimo acabado en el techo de la casa compraran materiales como: tubos, perlines, soldadores, sierras, galones de pinturas anticorresivas.
muy contenta doña Rita nos comenta que ya esta cerca de  ver cumplido su sueño.
texts.en:
Rita Maria continues working alongside her spouse toward their dream of finishing construction on their home. With much sacrifice and effort, they are making progress. With the support from this loan, they plan to finish the roof and purchase additional construction materials such as tubes, welders, saws, gallons of anti-corrosive paint and other materials.

Rita says that she is very happy, and is close to fulfilling her dream.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as welders, tubes, paint and other items.

loans.name: Rolando Concepcion

texts.es:
Don Rolando habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, en la comarca La Borgoña, muy esforzado y trabajador, el obtiene ingresos propios ya que labora como Jardinero para una institucion muy grande, el tiene como responsabilidad a su hermana, el la apoya con los gastos de sus estudios y quiere mejorar de vida, ademas el señor Rolando es agricultor en estos momento tiene una cosecha de una manzana de arboles de Aguacate, y con este fianciamiento podra realizarle un mantenimiento comprara. 12 quintales de completa 12-30-10 para que su cosecha sea de buena calidad y asi podre vendaerla en buen precio.
muy agradecido con Afodenic quien con fondo KIVA ayudan a personas necesitadas.
texts.en:
Rolando lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the county of La Borgoña. He is very determined and hard-working. He earns his own income, since he works as a gardener for a very large institution. He has family responsibilities for his sister; he supports her with the expenses for her studies, and he wants to help improve her life. In addition, Rolando is a farmer. At this time, he has a grove of avocado trees preparing for harvest, and with this loan he will be able to maintain his crop. He will buy 12 quintals [large sacks] of 12-30-10 fertilizer so that his harvest will be of good quality, and thus he will be able to sell it for a good price. 

He is very grateful to Afodenic, which, with the KIVA fund, helps people in need.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain a grove of avocado trees.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old. She is married and has one child. She has been running a retail shop for two years with a monthly income of 29,900 Kenyan Shillings. 

Susan has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more washing detergents, tea leaves, blue band, and soft drinks to sell.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her child's school fees. This is her second loan from KADET LTD, and she successfully paid back the previous loan. Her hope is to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more washing detergents, tea leaves, blue band, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María, sigue con sus ventas de ropa, durante estos años, ha captado su clientela, a si como ah invertido en su capital a través de los financiamientos, como algunas mejoras a su pequeña casa, en la construcción de paredes, hoy en día, cambiara parte del techo, y embaldosara en la cocina.
Comprara laminas de zinc y arena, cemento para comenzar la construcción, con mucho ánimo por lograr dar  a su familia un techo mejor.
texts.en:
María still runs her own clothing sales business, and, during her years of work, she has grown her customer base. Her hard work has paid off and has allowed her, over time, to make small repairs and improvements to her small house. Presently, she wants to repair part of her roof and instill tile in her kitchen.

With the support from this loan, she plans to purchase zinc and sand laminates as well as cement for starting the construction. She is very excited to be able to provide a better roof over her family's heads.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair the roof of her home and tile her kitchen

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro. habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, casado, el sea dedicado toda su vida al cultivo de sus tierras en estos momentos necesita darle mantenimiento a Una manzana y media de Piña que tiene sembrada para que asi su cultivo sea de buena calidad y al momento de venderla puedan pagarselas a buen precio.
gracias a Afodenic don Pedro comprara insumos para el  mantenimiento: Urea, Completa, Fertilizante.
con esto podra tener una mejora en sus ingresos y podra mejorar de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is married and lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He makes a living as a farmer, and tends about 2 1/2 acres of land that he has planted with pineapple plants. He hopes to produce a healthy, high quality crop which he plans to sell for a good price.

Thanks to Afodenic, Pedro plans to purchase input items for maintaining his crops, including urea, fertilizer, etc. He hopes these products will help to increase his profits and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase input materials for tending his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make a lean-to at her place of business, and to buy chairs.

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es:
Lesbia sigue laborando como maestra y en la costura, en donde todos estos años, ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, siendo madre soltera al ser viuda.
Atreves de los financiamiento ha mejorado su casa, en tener mejores condiciones de higiene, de seguridad, siendo créditos a plazos, pudiendo cumplir con sus compromisos de pagos. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo, comenzara la construcción de un pequeño cuarto en la parte de  atrás del solar. Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas, clavos para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Lesbia makes a living as a teacher and seamstress. As a result of her hard work over time, she has helped provide for her family and has helped them get ahead. She is a widow and single mother.

Through previous loans, she has been able to complete small construction projects on her house, and has improved the sanitation and security of her home and her family's living conditions. She has paid back loans successfully over time, and plans to use the support from this new loan to add on a small room at the back of her property. The building materials she plans to purchase for construction of the room are: stone, sand, cement, iron and nails.

loans.use: to build a room at the back of her property.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Karla tiene la edad de 36 años, casada y con dos hijos estudiantes, su esposo labora como conductor, en donde ella lo apoya con los gastos desde que inicio su pequeño negocio, que ha venido invirtiendo con las ganancias y ayuda de su compañero de vida.
Sus productos de ventas son de librería y cosméticos,  accesibles de precios y muy útil en la vida diario. Hoy quiere comprar más productos en cosméticos Avon, zermat, en lo que es cremas, perfume, vanidad, talcos, estuche de polvos, maquillaje, tonificador, a si como cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, reglas, pegas, type, libros y otros que son más demandados por sus clientes, que como fin, es  el crecimiento de su negocio, siendo posible por financiamiento en Afodenic que espera ventas y utilidades positivas.
texts.en:
Karla is 36 years old. She is married and has two children who are students. Her husband works as a driver, and she has helped him with the expenses since she started her small business. She has been investing in it with her earnings and with the help of her life partner. 

The products that she sells are paper goods and cosmetics which are reasonably priced and very useful in daily life. Today she wants to buy more products from the Avon and Zermat companies, including creams, perfumes, vanity sets, powder, powder cases, makeup, and tone, as well as notebooks, pens, erasers, rulers, glues, typing paper, books and other items that are most in demand among her customers. The goal is that her business will grow, which will be possible thanks to the loan through Afodenic and the expected sales and positive profits.

loans.use: to invest in buying cosmetics and paper goods to increase her sales.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is a housewife and small entrepreneur who lives in Cataggaman with her family. She runs a small store inside her house. Petra generates about 10,000 PHP each month. Being friendly to her customers, she also extends credit on her merchandise, but she ensures to collect it on weekends to use it to buy stocks. 

Now, Petra is borrowing a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, rice, eggs and bread to sell in her store. She aims to keep diversifying her business in order to achieve a better quality of life. Petra's photo was taken inside her store while she was busy arranging her stocks.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, rice, eggs and bread to sell in her store.

loans.name: Miriam Yalineth

texts.es:
La Señora Miriam habitante del minicipio de Ticuantepe de la comarca Buenos Aires, junto a su esposa estan construyendo su casa y entre los dos estas cumpliendo con su sueño y sobre todo ellos quieren mejorar de vida doña miriam recibe un ingreso mensual ya que ella trabaja como docente en un Centro Escolar su esposo trabaja y la apoya en con los gastos del hogar. con este Financiamiento que le han otorgado comprara los siguientes  materiales: Cemento, Bloques, Perlines, Zinc.
Muy Agradecida Doña Miriam nos expresa que esta contenta por ser beneficiada con este credito.
texts.en:
Miriam lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, in the Buenos Aires region. She and her husband are building a house for their family, and are working together to achieve their dream of having their own home. Miriam works as a teacher, and her husband also works and helps with household expenses. 

With the support from this loan, Miriam plans to purchase construction materials such as cement, blocks, zinc, metal beams and other items. Miriam is very grateful for the support she has received, and is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, blocks, metal beams, zinc, etc.

loans.name: Tynchtykgul

texts.ru:
Тынчтыкгул  44 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Тынчтыкгул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 23 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Тынчтыкгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  3 коровы с приплодом, 1 лошадь, продажа молока приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тынчтыкгул  обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дойных коров целях увеличения доходов от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  Доходы от кредита Тынчтыкгул будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Tynchtykgul is 44 years old, married and has two children.  As a source of her primary income, she has been involved in animal husbandry for 23 years, having started this business with a sum of 6,000 som.  Thanks to Tynchtykgul's hard work, today her business contains three cows with offspring and one horse, and the sales of milk yield about 15,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Tynchtykgul requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase dairy cows in order to increase her income from sales of milk and milk products.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sheravgan

texts.ru: Шеравган 30-летний женатый гражданин Таджикистана. Он проживает в городе Куляб. У него пятеро детей. Шеравган занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения сервизов, сувениров и наборов кухонных ножей.
texts.en: Sheravgan is a 30 year-old, married citizen of Tajikistan.  He lives in the city of Kulob.  He has five children.  Sheravgan is involved in selling household goods.  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase dishware sets, souvenirs and sets of kitchen knives.

loans.use: to purchase dishware sets, souvenirs and sets of kitchen knives

loans.name: Rakhat

texts.ru:
Рахат  40 лет, имеет 3 детей. Рахат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством и птицеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Рахат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  50 кур, 40 индюшек, 10 кроликов, 3 козы, 1 га яблоневого сада. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку нетели.  Доходы от кредита Рахат будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Rakhat is 40 years old and has three children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and poultry farming for ten years, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som.  Thanks to Rakhat's hard work, today her business contains 50 chickens, 40 turkeys, 10 rabbits, 3 goats and a 1 hectare apple orchard.  In order to further develop her business, Rakhat requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a heifer.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a continued development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and married to Dominic. They are blessed with an 18-year-old son. Jane operates a boutique shop in the town of Narok and has been running the business for 30 years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Jane has borrowed her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD with which she intends to purchase more clothing for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Aged 38 with five school-going children, Mariam is a married woman living in Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a kiosk operator who has been with this business for almost five months.

Mariam is requesting a loan from Yehu through Kiva, this being her first loan. She is requesting Ksh 20,000 to add to her stock of maize and wheat flour, rice and beans. She hopes to earn more income and improve her standard of living.

Her dream is to open a wholesale shop in future, though she faces a challenge of high cost of transport based on the fact that her business is so young with just a little capital. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize and wheat flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Aramat

texts.en:
Aramat is applying for his third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to have his crops sprayed with pesticides as well as acquire animals for resale.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dreams is to have a sustainable business

loans.use: to have his crops sprayed with pesticides as well as acquire animals for resale.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
