Kong is a resident living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She lives there with her family: her husband and three dependent children. At the same time, Kong sells fish caught by her husband, raises some poultry and plants crops to generate income for her family. She typically earns around USD 6.00 per day through her effort. Kong has been engaged in these businesses since 2003. She is now 43 years old.

In order to make healthy living conditions, Kong is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 1,500 to add to her capital to build a toilet and bathroom for household use. And with the remaining funds, she will purchase fishing materials for her husband. Kong aims to send her children to university after their studies at high school. She really appreciates all the help lenders gave her. Kong promises to pay her loan back to lenders honestly and punctually, as it’s now her fifth cycle loan from HKL.

loans.use: to build a toilet and bathroom for household use.

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: Anne  est une femme de 54 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 18 et 38 ans, 1 de ses enfants va encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle commercialise les vivres frais ( plantains) depuis 20 ans déjà. c'est grâce à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. Actuellement elle aimerait augmenter la quantité des plantains en achetant en gros ce qui limitera ses déplacement et réduira le coût du transport de ses marchandise. L'achat des platains en gros de devenir grossiste auprès de ses collègues,lui permettra d'augmenter son bénéfice, d'étendre son activité avec le temps et surtout d'économiser pour les rentrées scolaires prochaine de ses enfants. elle aimerai être un point de ravitaillement dans le futur.
texts.en: Anne is a 54 year old woman, married, and mother of 8 children whose ages vary between 18 and 38 years. One of her children is still going to school. She is a storekeeper in a market in the square where she has been selling fresh food (plantains) for 20 years already. It is thanks to this business that she can provide for her family. Now she would like to increase her quantity of plantains by buying wholesale, which will limit her travel and reduce the cost of transporting her merchandise. Buying plantains wholesale to become a distributor alongside her colleagues will allow her to increase her profits, to expand her business with time, and especially to save for her children's next back-to-school season. She would like to be a place to stock up in the future.

loans.use: to buy bunches of plantains wholesale.

loans.name: Las Muchachitas Del Ranchito Group

texts.es:
LAS MUCHACHITAS DEL RANCHITO ES UN GRUPO SOLODARIO DE CREDITUYO ESTA FORMADO POR 8 MUJERES SUS NOMBRES SON 
ADELAIDA , ADRIANA, CECILIA  MARTHA,  SARA SIMONA, YUVI, TERESA.
MARTHA ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES SE DEDICA ALA VENTA DE ABARROTES, ES CASADA CON UN HIJO DE 12 AÑOS DE EDAD.
SU PRESTAMO PIENSA UTILIZARLO, EN SURTIR MAS MARCANCIA Y ARREGLAR  SU NEGOCIO.YA QUE EL PISO ES DE TIERRA Y CUANDO LLUEVE SE INUNDA, ELLA QUIERE TENER BIEN ACONDICIONADO SU NEGOCIO ,Y TENER MUCHO SURTIDO DE MERCANCIA. SU SUEÑO ES LLEGAR A TENER UN LOCAL MAS GRANDE PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO SU HIJO LO PUEDA ATENDER Y QUE EL PUEDA VIVIR DE SU NEGOCIO SIN TENER QUE TRABAJAR EN OTRA PARTE.
texts.en:
The 8 members of LAS MUCHACHITAS DEL RANCHITO community bank are: Adelaida, Adriana, Cecilia Martha, Sara Simona, Yuvi, and Teresa.
Cecilia Martha has a grocery business.  She is married and has a 12-year old son.  She will use part of the loan to stock her store and the rest to carry out much-needed improvements.  She only has a dirt floor now and the store floods when it rains.  The investment will help her to improve the business and stock the merchandise she sells.  For the future, she wants a larger store.  She hopes her son will eventually help her with the business so that he doesn't have to go somewhere else to find work.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise that she will resell and install a floor for her grocery business.

loans.name: Parvizi

texts.ru: Парвиз житель города Куляб. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его отец занимается пчеловодством. Сам он арендует помещение, где открыл дилерский центр. Он в основном занимается пополнением счетов мобильных телефонов. Кроме того он занимается продажей панелей телефонов. В этой области он четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения запчастей телефонов.
texts.en: Parvizi is a resident of the city of Kulob.  He is 28 years old, married and has two children.  His father is involved in beekeeping.  Parvizi leases a space, where he opened a dealer center.  He is primarily involved in refilling mobile phone accounts.  Besides this, he sells phone panels.  He has been in this business for four years.  Parvizi is requesting this loan to purchase phone spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase phone spare parts

loans.name: Yahyojon

texts.ru: Яхьёчон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 24 года. Он женат. Яхьёчон более шести лет занимается скотоводством. Он берет кредит для закупа несколько голов бычков с целью увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Yahyojon lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 24 years old and married.  Yahyojon has been involved in animal husbandry for over six years.  He is requesting this loan to buy several bulls in order to increase his cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy several bulls

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a retail store owner. She is 53 years old, married to a farmer, and has seven children. They are not attending school anymore because some are already married while others have finished a degree and found local employment. 

Josefa would like to keep increasing sales capacity but she has insufficient fund now so she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, shampoo, soap and detergents to sell.

Josefa also hopes to keep extending good relationships with all her valued customers for more sales and profits. This will lead her to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, shampoo, soap and detergents to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children and her brother’s children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than seven years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a driver who earns about $5 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sokha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle-based three-wheeled vehicle) for her brother to run a delivery service. This purchase will help her brother generate additional income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her brother to run a delivery service.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 42 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from furniture-making and electronic re-loading.

Emelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  additonal stock to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 62 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Fe has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from ambulant vending of salted and fermented shrimp.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 33 years old and blessed with four children. He is a livestock trader and has been running the business for the past three years making a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has taken out a third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dream is to improve his living standards and venture into crop farming.

loans.use: to buy more animals for resale

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jelly is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jelly has been farming sugarcane for 16 years and also earns additional income from fish vending and buying and selling legumes.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Raujerene

texts.fr:
Raujerene est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 26 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant de 08 ans qui va à l'école. Comme activité, elle dispose d'un salon depuis 03 ans dans lequel elle fait également des soins esthétique. Avec ce crédit elle voudrait, elle voudrait acheter des paquets mèches, des greffes, des défrisants et des ongles artificielles afin de renforcer de son stock et mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle qui se trouve souvent obligée de se ravitailler auprès des concurrents en cas d'absence du produit sollicité. ce qui constitue un manque à gagner. 
elle a comme ambition pour son affaire d'ouvrir un second salon de coiffure et pour sa famille de mieux subvenir aux besoins scolaires et sanitaires de sa jeune fille.
texts.en:
Raujerene is a young woman from Cameroon of 26 years, single, and mother of one child, 8 years old, who goes to school. As a business, she has had a salon for three years, in which she also does beauty care. With this loan, she would like to buy packets of hair extensions, weaves, straighteners, and fake nails in order to reinforce her stock and better respond to the needs of her customers, who often find themselves obligated to restock from her competitors in cases when the product they are looking for is unavailable, which is a shortfall. 
Her ambition for her business is to open a second hair salon and for her family to better meet the health and education needs of her young girl.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (packets of hair extensions, straighteners, etc.)

loans.name: Cony Maria

texts.es:
Doña Cony, sigue con su negocio de venta de tortillas, leña y frijoles molidos, hoy en día también tiene dos molinos lo que se ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos,   palmea tortillas desde horas muy temprana para lograr vender más, ya que la competencia es mucha. Su esposo la apoya moral y económicamente, sus pequeños hijos siguen cursando el año escolar.
Cony se ayudado con los financiamientos que ha tenido, mejorando su inversión como su pequeña casa, lo que hará mejoras a  los cuartos, mejorando la privacidad  en su familia, al poder levantarlos en pared de concretos, para esta obra comprara: bloques, cemento, hierro, tablas para comenzar. Siendo Afodenic la puerta para el mejoramiento de un mejor techo.
texts.en:
Cony continues with her business selling tortillas, firewood, and ground up beans. Now she has 2 grinders which have helped to improve her income. She makes tortillas by hand from very early in the morning so that she can sell more, since there is much competition. Her husband helps her morally and economically. Her small children continue with their school year.

Cony has been helped by this financing, improving her investments, especially in her small house. She is making improvements to the rooms, enhancing her family's privacy by raising concrete walls. For this work she will purchase blocks, cement, iron, and boards to begin with. AFODENIC has been the doorway to other improvements such as a better roof.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build concrete walls for her little house.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Esteban de 50 años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos que dependen de el, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose desde hace 26 años al comercio y reparación de zapatos.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es de 10,000.00 lempiras, lo necesita para comprar ropa interior y para el complemento de un carro que desea comprar para transportar su mercadería.
Con apoyo del préstamo desea lograr sus objetivos que son tener su propio carro para utilizarlo en la venta de frutas que es otro negocio que el desea emprender.
El Sueño de Don Esteban es tener su propia casa y tener su carro para vender frutas.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban, 50, is married and has two children, both still at home.  He and his family live in San Lorenzo, a town in southern Honduras.  Don Esteban owns a retail business and repairs shoes for a living.  He has operated the businesses for 26 years.
Don Esteban will use this 10,000-lempiras loan to buy clothing--underwear--that he will resell plus a "carro" (probably a cart, but not clear) that he will use to transport his merchandise.
He wants to buy a "carro" of his own that he will use to start a fruit business.
For the future, Don Esteban wants a house of his own and a "carro" for selling fruit.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2012

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and buy a carro for his retail businesses.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.ru:
Сусанне 62 года, она проживает в городе Капане. Сусанна окончила Ереванский педагогический университет и получила специальность преподавателя французского языка и литературы. Почти 40 лет Сусанна преподает французский язык и литературу в школе, а также занимается репетиторской деятельностью у себя дома. Благодаря этому Сусанна обеспечивает большую часть доходов своей семьи. 
Сусанна замужем и у нее трое детей: два сына и дочь. Младший сын временно проживает в России, старший сын живет вместе с родителями и на данный момент он безработный, дочь замужем и живет отдельно от родителей. Муж Сусанны работает лесником. 
Сусанне необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для ремонта преподавательской комнаты в своей квартире, а также для покупки нового стола, стульев и необходимых учебников для проведения своих частных занятий.
Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Сусанной от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon).
texts.en: Susanna is 62 years old.  She lives in the city of Kapan.  Susanna graduated from the Yerevan Pedagogical University and received a teaching degree in French language and literature.  Susanna has been teaching French language and literature at a school for almost 40 years and is also involved in teaching private lessons at home.  Thanks to this, she contributes the major portion of her family's income.  Susanna is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter.  The youngest son temporarily lives in Russia, the oldest lives with the parents and is currently unemployed, and the daughter is married and lives separately from the parents.  Susanna's husband works as a forest ranger.  Susanna needs a loan in the amount of 500,000 dram to repair the teaching space in her apartment and also to buy a new desk, chairs and necessary textbooks for holding her private lessons.  This is Susanna's third loan from the Nor Horizon organization.

loans.use: to repair the teaching space in her apartment and also to buy a new desk, chairs and necessary textbooks for lessons

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал житель города Худжанд. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Akmal is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 28 years old, married and has three children.  He earns a living by breeding cattle.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  Akmal is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 37 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Jelly has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Jelly aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail for 7 years and also earns an income from livestock raising and her general store.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Flaurence

texts.fr:
Flaurence est une dame âgée 38 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 06 et 12 ans. tous ses enfants vont à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente de boissons et produits alimentaires dans un quartier de la ville depuis 04 ans . elle a été victime d'un coup de vol à son activité depuis quelque temps, ce qui a fait chuter cette dernière en terme de stock et elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter des boissons hygiéniques, alcoolisées et des produits alimentaires pour remonter son niveau de stock afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
son souci majeur pour sa famille est d'assurer les besoins scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Flaurence is a 38 year old woman, married and mother of 4 children, whose ages range between 6 and 12 years. All of her children go to school. She has run a business selling drinks and food products in an area of the city for four years. She was the victim of a robbery at her business a little while ago, which caused her stock to fall, and with this loan she would like to buy health drinks, alcoholic drinks and food products to bring her stock back up in order to better respond to the needs of her customers.
Her major worry for her family is to provide for the health and education needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine est une femme mariée de 31 ans mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 7 et 10 ans, les deux vont à l'école. elle avait ouvert et gère un petit atelier de couture mélangé d'une mercerie dans quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans déjà. son activité fonctionne grâce à son savoir faire, son expérience qui lui permis d'agrandir  clientèle au fil du temps. Elle aimerai acheter le matériel de couture en gros pour remplir sa petite mercerie (bobine de de fil, tissus, aiguilles fermetures)et détailler à ses clients. ceci l'aidera aussi pour la confection de des vêtement qu'elle coud pour revendre. Elle aimerai économiser le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour aider son époux avec une partie de la scolarité de leurs enfants et garder le reste parce qu'elle aimerai ouvrir un autre atelier.
texts.en: Josephine is a 31 year old married woman with two children, aged between 7 and 10 years. Both go to school. She opened and has run a small sewing shop mixed with a notions store in an area of the city for three years already. Her business works thanks to her knowledge and her experience which has allowed her to increase her customer base with time. She would like to buy sewing material wholesale to stock her little notions shop (bobbins of thread, fabric, needles, clasps) and sell retail to her customers. This will also help her for the clothing that she sews to resell. She would like to save the profits that this loan will bring her to help her husband with a portion of the education of their children and keep the rest because she would like to open another studio.

loans.use: to buy everyday items for sewing.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 39 años de edad, es un hombre muy amable y emprendedor. Su pareja es Pilar, con quien tiene dos hijos: Amy de 6 años y Cesar de 3 años. Viven en la casa que lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. 
Su negocio es el alquiler de su motocarro para el transporte de pasajeros. Empezó hace más de un año debido a la demanda de este servicio en su región. Esto le permite tener ingresos económicos adicionales a su trabajo dependiente. Pero el problema es cuando llueve muy seguido, pues se malogran las calles y produce un gran desgaste del motocarro y se malogran rápidamente, pero eso no lo desanima y continúa con su negocio. Su meta es tener una flota para formar una pequeña empresa de transportes.

Este es su préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP, por lo que se siente contento de contar con este apoyo financiero, por eso asegura será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse muy cómodo con su grupo, ya que los considera buenas personas y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de un motor para su motocarro valorizado en 550 nuevos soles, más algunos repuestos y así mantener en buen estado su vehículo.
texts.en:
César, 39, is a very kind and enterprising man.  His partner is Pilar, with whom he has two children: Amy, 6, and César, 3.  They live in the house they managed to buy with great effort.

His business is renting out his motorcycle cart to transport passengers.  He began more than a year ago because of the demand for this service in his area.  This allows him to have income in addition to his dependent job.  The problem is when it rains a lot, because the roads get damaged and this wears out his vehicle.  But he continues with his business and doesn't get discouraged.  His goal is to have a fleet to start a small transportation business.

This is his seventh loan with MFP.  He is happy to have this financial support, so he is sure that he will be punctual in making his payments.  In addition, he feels very comfortable with his group because he considers them to be very good people and very supportive.

With the requested amount of 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] he will invest in buy a motor for his motorcycle cart for 550 nuevos soles, in addition to some parts so he can keep his vehicle in good condition.

loans.use: to buy a motor and parts for his motorcycle cart.

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam has only two sons and a hard-working husband. Her youngest son is in 8th standard grade.  She is a housewife, and her husband and elder son work for the income of the household.

Maryam needs a loan from Kiva Partner Asasah for her son's motorcycle and bicycle repair shop business. Her son is an expert in his work, but due to the lack of money he has not got the sufficient stuff needed to repair bicycles and motorcycles. With this loan, he will buy different tools used in the repair of motorcycles and bicycles.

After this loan, Maryam expects her son to run his shop smoothly so he can earn money for their house and improve their poor conditions.

loans.use: To buy tools for bicycle and motorbike repairing business

loans.name: Hamida's Group

texts.en:
Hamida is married with four children: 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her elder son works, while younger one is studying. Her daughters remain at home and support Hamida in her daily household tasks.

Hamida's husband is a day laborer, while she does embroidery to support her family financially.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, for the further expansion of her embroidery business.  With the loan investment, she will buy beads, colored thread, and embroidery frames to improve her services. This will help her get more orders and increase her profits.

She has been operating her business for many years and she is confident about her business success after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials for her embriodery business

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is 48 years old. She is married and resides with a son in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband runs a business of distilling alcohol and earns about $5 per day. Her son is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophal is requesting this loan to purchase piglets and fodder to use for breeding pigs. This money will help her expand her business. In the future, she would like to expand her pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and fodder to use for breeding pigs.

loans.name: 05.01. 53 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Dung is 42 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her family in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has a retail business selling clothes.  Dung has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2011, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and is now requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. Dung is the leader of a 3-member group, the 05.01. 53 Điện Biên solidarity group. 

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es:
Doña  Melchi de 36 años de edad, es casada vive en su casa junto con sus dos hijos quienes van al colegio, y su esposo trabaja como policía, la señora Melchi se dedica al comercio de venta de plásticos como: vasos, pailas, basureros, cubetas, mesas plásticas, sillas, y también queso, mantequilla y quesillo la venta de lácteos la realiza de manera ambulante en los lugares aledaños a su comunidad, ubicada en San Antonio de Flores Honduras.
Doña Melchi solicita el préstamo para comprar lácteos como Mantequilla, queso y quesillo ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo este producto en esta época. Con el apoyo de este crédito la señora seguirá mejorando su negocio y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño de doña Melchi es que sus hijos se le gradúen de la universidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Doña Melchi, 36, is married and lives in her own house with her two children who attend school; her husband works as a police officer.  Melchi works selling plastic ware like glasses, pans, trash cans, plastic tables and chairs; she also sells cheese, butter and string cheese.  She sells the dairy products from place to place in areas adjacent to her community which is located in San Antonio de Flores, Honduras.

Doña Melchi is asking for a loan to buy dairy products like butter, cheese and string cheese because her customers are requesting these products this season.  With support from the loan she will continue improving her business and her quality of life.

Melchi’s dream is that her children graduate from University.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – June, 2012

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Ей 47 лет. Она в основном откармливает и продает скот. Мавлуда замужем. У нее двое детей. Она берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Mavluda has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  She is 47 years old.  She primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  Mavluda is married and has two children.  She is requesting this loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves and bulls

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Мунира уже четыре года как занимается торговлей. У нее имеется собственный мебельный магазин, где она работает продавцом. Кредит берет для приобретения нового товара.
texts.en: Munira lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 25 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  Munira has been involved in sales for four years.  She owns a furniture store, where she works as a salesperson.  She is requesting this loan to purchase new merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom sets

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон более десяти лет занимается торговлей шин и ремонтом автомашин. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он берет кредит для приобретения запчастей автомашин для торговли. Кроме того Султон намерен закупить крупнорогатый скот.
texts.en: Sulton has been involved in selling tires and repairing cars.  He is 33 years old, married and has three children.  He is requesting this loan to purchase spare auto parts for resale.  Besides this, Sulton intends to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and calves

loans.name: Mamadnazar

texts.ru: Мамадназар проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Мамадназар более семи лет занимается скотоводством. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Mamadnazar lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 36 years old, married and has four children.  Mamadnazar has been involved in animal husbandry for over seven years.  He primarily breeds livestock for subsequent resale.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.fr: Marie Chantal est une femme de 43 ans célibataire mère de 2 enfants qui vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis  2 ans ou elle vend les vivres secs (riz et arachides), c'est grâce à ce petit commerce qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa petite famille. Son commerce fonctionne mais elle a juste un problème de capital qui l'empêche d'acheter des quantités importantes pour revendre, elle est obligé d'acheter à chaque un ou deux sacs, d'attendre qu'elle finisse de vendre pour acheter à nouveau. Grace à ce crédit, elle pourra acheter plusieurs sacs, ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, augmentera ses ventes et dont ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie du bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit dans son activité en ajoutant les sacs de riz et d'arachide,et économisera l'autre pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Marie Chantal is a 43 year old single woman, mother of two children who go to school. She has been a storekeeper in a market in the capitol for two years where she sells dry goods (rice and groundnuts). It is thanks to this small business that she provides for the needs of her small family. Her business works, but she just has a capital problem, which prevents her from buying large quantities to resell. She has to buy one or two bags at a time and wait until she has finished them to buy again. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy several bags, which will allow her to better satisfy her customers and increase her sales and therefore her profits. She will reinvest a portion of her profits that this loan will bring her in her business in buying bags of rice and groundnuts, and will save the other for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr: Agathe est une femme de 49 ans, veuve et mère de 06 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 16 et 26 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont encore à l'école et elle a également à sa charge quatre de ses petits fils. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 04 ans où elle vend des vivres frais (maïs, bananes, plantains) selon les saisons.la vente de bananes et plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures  et ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors  de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait  d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de le diversifier et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Agathe is a 49 year old woman, widow and mother of 6 children whose ages range between 16 and 26 years. Two of her children still go to school and she also has four of her grandchildren in her care. She has been a shopkeeper in a market in the capitol for four years where she sells fresh food (corn, bananas, plantains) according to the seasons. The sale of bananas and plantains is a lucrative business, but the small size of her product stock leads to numerous breaks and doesn't allow her to satisfy her customers. This loan will allow her to stock up in large quantity in order to better respond to the demands of her customers and from this to increase her sales and her profits. She will reinvest a part of her profits in her business in order to diversify it and use the other to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy plantains and bananas wholesale.

loans.name: Ma. Riza

texts.en:
Ma. Riza is 39 years old and married with 2 children.

Ma. Riza is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Riza has been farming vegetables for 7 years now.  She has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es:
Oscar es una persona muy trabajadora, por esto adicional a que trabaja como mayordomo en el cuidado de una finca, tiene un criadero de cerdos y de pollos que mantiene en la finca de su patrón ya que allí le brindan un espacio para el cuidado de estos animales. Con la actividad de la crianza y venta de cerdos y pollos ha logrado generar ingresos extras con los que su familia tiene la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida, por esto Oscar siempre busca seguir creciendo en este negocio. El negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba en otra finca y le tocaba desempeñar esta labor, y cuando un hermano suyo le regaló un cerdo para la crianza comenzó con el negocio que todavía tiene actualmente. Gracias a que tienen muy buena crianza sus animales las ventas cada vez siguen creciendo, por esto Oscar requiere un préstamo para comprar cerdos y gallinas para tener la cantidad de animales que demandan sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá responder a todos los pedidos que hacen sus clientes y así poder tener unos buenos ingresos para su hogar. Además, su esposa y sus 2 hijos podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Oscar works hard to make ends meet.  He is a foreman on a nearby farm and raises pigs and chickens on land that his employer set aside for him to use for his business.  The extra income he makes from selling the animals has allowed him to improve his family's quality of life.  Consequently, he is constantly looking for ways to grow the business.  He learned everything he needed to know to raise animals at a farm where he worked before, but only to care for the owner's animals.  His brother then gave him a pig to raise and that's how he started his own business.  Thanks to the care he takes with his animals, his business has grown and grown.  Oscar now needs a loan to buy pigs and chickens so that he can meet demand.

The investment will allow him to fill the orders he has and, in turn, increase the income he needs to support his family.  He wants to make sure that his wife and 2 children have a better quality of life and a chance to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens for his animal sales business.

loans.name: Janeth Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Janneth es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por una comunidad que pertenece al cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene accidentada geografía la cual le da un clima frió y grandes extensiones para disfrutar de la naturaleza fuera de la rutina de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Janneth tiene 28 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil por el cantón o en la ciudad de Cuenca, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Janneth se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, a la cría y venta de ganado, cerdos y cuyes y también a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es para su consumo y para la venta.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el  banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando semillas, abono y alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es de llegar a tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Janneth is a member of the “Nuevo Bankito La Ramada” communal bank.  She lives in a community belonging to Nabón Commune, a place with fractured topography, cold climate and large extensions where one can enjoy nature away from city routines.  Its people raise animals, farm and many head into the city daily to work in various economic activities; they still preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Janneth is 28-years-old, married and has had two children who are 9 and 7-years-old and are attending the little local elementary school.  Her husband works as a bricklayer in the canton or in the city of Cuenca.  The house they live in is theirs.

Janneth does housework and also raises cattle, pigs and guinea pigs; she also farms and what she grows is both for home consumption and to sell.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy seeds, manure and animal feed.  Her goal is to have a business of her own like a store.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and animal feed.

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en:
Yegana, a 54-year-old woman raising five children alone, grows seasonal fruits and vegetables, having previously bred cattle for more than 10 years. An IDP living in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement, she receives 40 AZN in financial support from the government monthly, but this is too low to cover family needs. Assisted by her son, Yegana sells her crops in the central bazaar, earning a monthly income of 300 AZN, and this business is the family's main source of income.

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy, with many national dishes being made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the average Azerbaijan family, so Yegana wants to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is therefore requesting her third loan for 1500 AZN to purchase new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get his taxi back.

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like can goods, noodles, spices, egg, soft drinks, etc. for her general store.

Ma. Rochel has previously borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase can goods, noodles, spices, egg, soft drinks, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Hazel

texts.es:
Hazel,  comerciante de ropa usada y alquiler de cuartos, sigue ofertando sus productos en ropa variada, de dama, niños, caballeros, así como el mejoramiento de su casa, y ahora va a dar mantenimiento a cinco cuartos de alquiler que tiene, dando un mejor techo y acondicionamiento a sus clientes, que es donde se ayuda mas económicamente al tener entradas fijas.
Mejoras que hará con financiamientos otorgados en Afodenic, siendo en cuotas  a plazos accesible para su bolsillo, y haciendo sus obras de mejora en corto lapso, cambiando el  techo y aguas negras.
texts.en:
Hazel still has her used clothing business.  She sells all kinds of clothing for men, women and children.  She also rents rooms to make ends meet and she's applying for a loan that she will use to make improvements to the five rooms she rents.  She will invest the loan in a new roof and other improvements that will make the rooms more attractive to her boarders.
She will use Afodenic's loan to make the improvements.  She can afford the investment because she can pay for the work immediately and repay the loan in installments.

loans.use: to pay for improvements for room-rental business.

loans.name: Amalia Cecibel

texts.es: Amalia es de Libertad y en esa ciudad vive con su familia. Ella y su esposo Marco se dedican a la pesca. Juntos tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 10 años que estudian en el colegio fiscal. A sus 31 años, Amalia vive en una casa de su propiedad que cuenta con solo agua y luz ya que está ubicada en una loma la cual no tiene delimitado camino pavimentado. La pesca la aprendió por su esposo quien le enseño el trabajo y la realiza para ayudarle con la economía del hogar al no encontrar trabajo. Al principio tenía miedo a la marea y los peligros que conlleva esta profesión pero al pasar el tiempo se fue adaptando, le gusta el aire fresco y no se marea. Realizan la labor de lunes a sábados desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 11 del día, luego llevan la pesca para su venta, solo trabajan esta días ya que es cuando más compran los pequeños vendedores y el domingo se toman un descanso arreglado las redes. La mayor preocupación de Amalia y su esposo son los ladrones y piratas ya que roban el producto pescado, roban motores y a veces dañan las embarcaciones es por eso que su esposo al finalizar la labor con ayuda guarda su motor en casa ya que es nuevo y lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo. Tiene 13 años dedicándose a la pesca y siente que por fin está teniendo mayores resultados ya que ha podido arreglar su casa y comprar un motor nuevo para su embarcación haciéndola más confiable. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de redes ya que están deterioradas y hacerle algunos arreglos a la embarcación.
texts.en:
Amalia is from Libertad and lives in that city with her family.  She and her husband, Marcos, fish.  They have two children who are 6 and 10 years old and attend public school.  

At the age of 31, Amalia lives in a house that’s hers that only has water and electricity since it’s built on a hill that does not have paved roads.  She learned to fish from her husband who taught her how and she does it to help him with the household economy since she did not find a job.  

At the beginning she was afraid of the waves and the dangers inherent in this profession but as time went by she became accustomed to it.  She likes the fresh air and she does not get seasick.  

They work from Monday through Saturday from 5am until 11am and then take their catches to be sold.  They only work these days because that’s when small vendors buy the most and they use Sundays to repair their nets.  

Amalia’s and her husband’s greatest concern is robbers and pirates that steal the catches of fish, they steal motors and sometimes damage the boats which is why when her husband finishes the day’s work he gets help to store his motor at home because it’s new and he put in a lot of effort to acquire it.  

She’s been fishing for 13 years and feels that she’s finally getting good results because she’s been able to fix up her house and to buy a new motor for the boat making it more comfortable.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy nets because they are deteriorated and to make some improvements to the boat.

loans.use: to buy nets and equipment.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Con 12,720 pesos Bernardo podrá comprar mercancía para su negocio de medicina natural. Además Bernardo vende ropa a sus clientes. Ambas mercancías son vendidas a credito hasta a 60 dias, por lo que a Bernardo a veces le resulta dificil reabastecer el inventario. Bernardo tiene 21 años y vive con su novia. 
El desea que su negocio crezca y se fortalezca para poder ir a la universidad
texts.en:
With 12,720 pesos, Bernardo will be able to purchase merchandise for his natural medicines business. Bernardo also sells clothes to his customers. He sells both types of merchandise on credit for up to 60 days, which makes it hard for him sometimes to restock his inventory. 

Bernardo is 21 years old and lives with his girlfriend. He wants his business to grow and strengthen so that he can go to university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: This time, Carmencita is borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for fishing. This business was previously funded through NWTF. This KIVA partner continues to provide for Carmencita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a fish-selling business, a business she has operated for the last year. She buys fresh fish from fish mongers. She also depends on her husband for additional income.
Mwanamisi is requesting her second loan with Yehu, which she will use to buy more fish and cooking oil for her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase her stock, earn more income to feed her family, and build her savings for her children and the future.
She continues to dream of expanding the business and opening a shop in future, even as she and her husband make sure that their children get quality education.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Rosaline Afiavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Rosaline Afiavi vend des sacs, des pagnes, des bazins et des bijoux depuis des années. Rosaline Afiavi fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés de la sous région et sa clientèle est essentiellement composée des béninois et des togolais. Soucieuse de renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de combler les attentes de ses clients et de maximiser son intérêt, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un financement à Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Married and mother of three children in school, the oldest of whom is 15 years and the youngest of whom is 4, Rosaline Afiavi has sold purses, pagnes (colorful wax cloth), damask cloth, and jewelry for years. Rosaline Afiavi stocks up in one of the markets of the sub-region, and her customers are for the most part from Benin and Togo. Worried about restocking her working capital in order to satisfy her client's expectations and to maximize her interest, she has asked for and received a loan from Finadev. This loan will permit her to participate in paying for her children's education and to provide their needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 purses, 10 pagnes (colorful wax cloth), 12 damask cloths, and a dozen pieces of jewelry.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is requesting a loan of 600 to add to her working capital to buy more things to put in her store. She wants to make a bigger store in the future so that she can make a bigger income.

loans.use: To buy eggs, candies, and other things to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 50 years old. She has two children. She is a building worker and a farmer who raises pigs to sell. She earns from it 4,500,000 VND a month. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,944,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to upgrade her pigsty and hen-coop. Then, she hopes her business brings in enough money for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: to upgrade her pigsty and hen-coop.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria de 36 años vive en Libertad, la casa es alquilada ya que no ha contado con el dinero para poder comprar una. Lleva 7 años dedicándose a la venta de comida preparada en un restaurant que alquila en el mercado de la ciudad. Comenzó el negocio cuando fue a vivir a Libertad ya que su ciudad natal el Chimborazo, donde se dedicaba a la misma actividad. Al principio se le hizo un poco difícil porque no conocía a mucha gente y los cambios siempre son un poco difíciles, pero gracias a Dios actualmente goza de mucha popularidad por su sazón. Hoy en día Maria tiene un restaurant bien ubicado, una excelente clientela y varios empleados que le ayudan en el negocio. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo siendo que los fines de semana son más productivos por el turismo. Comenta que tiene este ritmo de vida porque está soltera y su hija vive en Riobamba con su papá y gracias a esto se dedica por completo a su trabajo ya que depende por completo de él. Este es el primer crédito que solicita Maria con el cual piensa comprar ollas porque las suyas están deterioradas, platos, vasos, arroz por quintales, pollos, carne y tener dinero para la compra de diaria de los productos con los cuales prepara la comida. A futuro desea tener su casa propia así no pagar arriendo y poder tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María, 36, lives in Libertad in a rented house because she’s not had the money to buy one.  She’s been selling prepared food for 7 years in a restaurant she rents in the city market.  She started the business when she moved to Libertad since her place of birth is Chimborazo where she also did the same kind of work.  At the beginning it was a bit difficult for her because she didn’t know many people and change is always difficult but thanks to God she currently is very popular due to her delicious cooking.

Today, María has a well-situated restaurant, an excellent clientele and several employees that help her in the business.  Her work schedule is Monday through Sunday and weekends are the busiest due to tourism.  She comments that she has this pace of life because she’s single and her daughter lives in Riobamba with her father and thanks to this she dedicates all her time to her work since she is totally dependent on it.  

This is María’s first loan request and she plans to use it to buy pots because hers are deteriorated, glasses, dishes, rice by the quintal, chicken and meat and to have money for the daily purchase of products she uses to prepare the food.  In the future, she’d like to own a house and not pay rent any longer and to be able to earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes, rice and chicken.

loans.name: Lisseth Johanna

texts.es: Lisseth vive en la ciudad de Milagros junto a su familia. A sus 23 años tiene un estudio fotográfico de su propiedad el cual abrió hace 5 años cuando termino sus estudios secundarios. Comenta que siempre le gusto tomar fotografías ya sea con su cámara digital o del teléfono dándose cuenta que lo hacía bien, decidió tomar varios cursos y abrir el negocio. En un principio adquirió una cámara profesional ofreciendo los servicios de fotografías a eventos, también vendía productos como cámaras, películas y el servicio de revelado. Actualmente trabaja de lunes a domingo junto a su esposo quien es ingeniero en Telecomunicaciones, no tiene horario definido. Fue por los conocimientos de su esposo que decidieron comprar una videocámara para ampliar sus servicios en los eventos y es él quien le enseño el manejo de la misma. Con el préstamo Lisseth planea comprar otra cámara profesional y video cámara y así poder trabajar por separado cuando hay eventos el mismo día y no perder trabajos por la falta de quipos. Su meta a futuro es ampliar su negocio con la compra de más equipos ya que el tiempo y la innovación tecnológica lo ameritan.
texts.en:
Lisseth lives with her family in the city of Milagros.  At the age of 23 she owns a photographic studio she opened five years ago when she finished secondary school.  She comments that she always liked taking photographs either with her digital camera or with her telephone and noted that she was good at it so decided to take several courses and open the business.  

At the beginning she acquired a professional camera and offered services at events; she also sold products like cameras, film and film developing service.  She currently works Monday through Sunday together with her husband who is a Telecommunications Engineer.  She does not have a fixed schedule.

Because of her husband’s skills they decided to buy a video camera to expand their services at events and he taught her how to operate it.  Lisseth plans to use the loan to buy another professional camera and a video camera to work separately when there is more than one event on the same day and not lose jobs for lack of equipment.  Her future goal is to expand the business with the purchase of more equipment because time and technological innovation requires it.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera and a video camera.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, and other needed items to sell

loans.name: Bayantungalag

texts.en:
Bayantungalag is a 53-year-old widow who lives in a ger district (which lacks basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She has two children ages 35 and 29. She had worked at local police center and retired in 2010. 

Bayantungalag has been operating a clothing retail stall business since 2010, when she retired. She operates her business at the local indoor market. She sells a wide range of clothing imported from Beijing and Ereen, the border city of China. The great Mongolian holiday Naadam will be held very soon and she wants to purchase more clothes to sell during the Naadam, which is a high shopping season in Mongolia, so she requests a 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan. 

“It’s really difficult to live alone and receive income from my children, thus I decided to make own business and with my business profit I can live and buy all the necessary things without the income from my children. They have their own life, so I don’t want to interfere with my children’s life,” she said.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell during the Naadam holiday.

loans.name: Mindalina

texts.en:
Mindalina is 44 years old and married with 1 child.

Mindalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries items to sell.

Mindalina has been in this business for 7 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Mindalina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Tapdiq

texts.en:
Tapdiq is a 54-year-old man who is married with three children. He is IDP and lives with his family in Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. He is farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 28 years. Tapdiq is on pension. 

Over the years, Tapdiq gained enough skills and experience to run the business thanks to his father`s experience. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy; many national dishes made of vegetable, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch. Tapdiq usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Tapdiq wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand and to increase his monthly income. For this purpose, he applied for 1500 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 37 years old and married with 3 children.

Clarissa is in the agricultural business, raising carabao (water buffalo) in the Philippines. Clarissa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy carabao for plowing sugarcane fields.

Clarissa has also been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy carabao (water buffalo) for plowing sugarcane fields.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 30-year-old married woman who has two children who are aged seven and eight years.  She is involved in farming.  She tills her land to grow crops of rice to sell at her town's market.  In addition, Marlyn runs a small sari-sari store, or general store.  

She works hard to help sustain her family.  Marlyn is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for the farm and additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods and toiletries.

She hopes to have a successful farming business in the future.   She also hopes to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the farm and additional merchandise to sell such as canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 52 años. Vive en compañía de su esposo Elías, con quien tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes, ahora sólo está con los cuatro restantes. Su casa es propia y está  ubicada en la localidad de Daniel Hernández.  

Hace 4 años decidió abrir su propia tienda de comestibles en su misma vivienda. Todas las mañanas ofrece a sus clientes, panes calientes, bebidas, verduras e incluso, hace poco vende, madejas de lana, pues las vecinas del barrio gustan mucho de tejer. En todo este tiempo logró incrementar, poco a poco, la clientela, “aún me falta llenar mi tienda con más productos, esa es mi meta”, afirma doña Juana. Quien se siente contenta con el pequeño progreso que tiene. Por el momento desea mejorar en las ventas para poder remodelar su tienda, sabe que lo conseguirá, pues su esposo trabaja como peón, limpiando y cosechando diversos chacras, donde le pagan un sueldo diario, con lo que puede solventar los gastos familiares. 

Este es su crédito número 3 con MFP y agradece el apoyo brindado, pues en todo ese tiempo logró incrementar sus ganancias, las que le sirvieron para adquirir mejoras en su negocio, por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Juana invertirá este dinero en surtir su tienda de comestibles con dulces, bebidas y demás productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Juana, 52, lives with her husband, Elias.  They have six children, two of whom are independent and living away from their parents.  The other four children live with their parents in the Daniel Hernandez neighborhood, in a house that they own.  

Juana decided to open a grocery 4 years ago.  She operates the business in a space in her house.  She sells bread--hot from the oven--drinks, vegetables and--just recently--hanks of wool.  Many of Juana's neighbors like to knit and now they can buy wool from her.  She has managed to grow the business, bit by bit, and says that her goal is to expand because she "hasn't yet been able to stock all the merchandise" that she'd like to sell.  Even so, she is happy with the progress she's made and is planning future improvements to the store.  She knows what she needs, but she doesn't have enough money to carry out her plans.  Her husband is a day laborer, doing farm work on various local farms, and all of his income goes to paying the family's expenses.  

This is Juana's 3rd MFP loan.  She is grateful for your help because past loans have allowed her to improve her business and, in turn, her income.  She knows that she has to repay this loan in the agreed-upon time to get future loans.  Juana will use this loan to stock her store with snacks, drinks and other everyday merchandise.

loans.use: to stock her grocery.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor es una madre soltera de 41 años que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, la tienda está ubicada en su domicilio en Milagros. Vive con sus dos 2 hijos quienes están en la etapa escolar y estudian en instituciones fiscales. La tienda la inicio cuando su esposo la abandono con sus hijos y al ser ama de casa no tenía experiencia laboral, con un dinero que presto a un familiar compro productos de venta diaria como arroz, azúcar, viveras, aceite, colas. Pasando el tiempo empezó a reunir dinero y adquirir más productos, de eso ha pasado ya 5 años en los cuales ha ganado experiencia en ventas, administración de su negocio y atención al público. Flor inicia sus actividades en la tienda a partir de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días, como vive ahí mismo lo puede hacer sin alterar sus actividades familiares que consisten en ayudar a sus hijos con las tareas. El crédito que solicita Flor es para la compra de víveres, lácteos, embutidos esperando a futuro que su despensa esta surtida y así tener la utilidad necesaria para realizarle arreglos a su casa.
texts.en:
Flor, 41, is a single mother who sells basic staple items in her store located at home in Milagros.  She lives with her two children who are school age and attending public schools.  

She opened the store when her husband abandoned her with her children and being a housewife had no work experience.  She used money a relative lent her to buy basic staple items like rice, sugar, foodstuffs, oil and soft-drinks.  As time went by she acquired money and more products.  Five years have gone by in which she’s gained experience in sales, business administration and customer service.  

Flor starts her activities in the store at 7am and goes until 8pm every day.  Since she also lives there she can do this without altering her family activities which consist in helping her children with their homework.  

The loan Flor is requesting is to buy foodstuffs, dairy products and cured meats hoping in future to have a well-stocked store that will produce the necessary profits to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Wilmer Fabian

texts.es: En la ciudad de Milagros vive Wilmer quien es chofer profesional y se dedica a dar servicio de taxi. A sus 27 años tiene 5 dedicándose a esta actividad empezando como conductor de vehículo particular, en la actualidad está en proceso de sacar la licencia profesional con la cual legalizara su taxi en una cooperativa. La actividad la realiza de lunes a domingos todo el día ya que recorre la ciudad constantemente en la búsqueda de pasajeros. Wilmer está casado con Mayra quien es ama de casa y de dedica al cuidado de sus hijos quienes asisten a la escuela fiscal. Es préstamo que está solicitando Wilmer es para cubrir los gastos de legalización de su taxi los cuales son: licencia profesional, radio instalada para informar de su ubicación a la empresa y seguro de su taxi. Espera que en esta nueva etapa de su trabajo mejoren sus ganancias para poder brindarle un mayor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer lives in the city of Milagros; he’s a professional driver providing taxi service.  At the age of 27 he’s been in this line of work for 5 years having started out driving a private car.  He’s currently in the process of getting his professional license which legalizes his taxi as part of a cooperative.  He works from Monday through Sunday all day since he drives around the city constantly looking for passengers.

Wilmer is married to Mayra who is a housewife in charge of caring for their children who attend public school.  The loan he’s asking for is to cover costs of legalizing his taxi which are: professional license, installation of radio so the firm can locate him and insurance for the taxi.  He hopes that in this new work stage his profits will increase and he’ll be able to give his family greater wellbeing.

loans.use: to pay for his professional license, the radio and insurance.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old. She is married and has 3 children.  She is from Gala, Ozamiz City.  Susan has been operating a farming business for 21 years.  She earns 20,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Susan joined GDMPC. 

Susan is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 57 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery items to sell.

Herminia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from "nipa" making (woven palm mats use for house construction and repair). Herminia aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 56-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Ilham, his soul mate and the mother of his two children, of whom one is working and the other is still attending school. Despite his older age, Ali is obliged to work continually as he is the breadwinner, responsible for covering his family expenses, especially his child’s education fees. 

Ali owns an orchard, where he provides his customers a great quantity of fresh fruits. He has been involved in this occupation since 1992. He suffers from a bad financial situation.  That’s why he’s asking today for a loan from Ameen s.a.l, a Kiva partner, to improve his business by purchasing an electrical generator for the well to irrigate the trees and increase his productivity. He believes that this Kiva loan will also allow him to offer a greater quality of products and thus improve his income by minimum of 30%.

loans.use: to improve his orchard by purchasing an electrical generator for the well.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-age children. With the cooperation of his wife, he is able to satisfy his family's needs and offer them a fair way of living.  Nabil owns a small mini-market where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. As for his wife, she works as a teacher to help him cover their family expenses. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. In that way he will be able to diversify his inventory and therefore increase his revenues and his standard of living. Nabil looks forward to expanding his grocery, waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign his children to ownership of these branches.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market.

loans.name: Mehrali

texts.en:
Mehrali is a 36-year-old man on pension, married with three children. He is IDP and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Mehrali has more than 5 years of experience in this field thanks to his father who taught the best methods for raising cattle.

Mehrali usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for a higher price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Selling milk and meat brings in 250 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt souse. Dairy products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

Mehrali is the only worker in his family, and his income is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Mehrali applied for 1200 AZN to purchase one dairy cow and fodder. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest. Mehrali has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy six sheep to rear.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 22 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, esta joven trabajadora vive en Milagros en la casa de sus padres ya que es soltera. La actividad que desempeña le gusto desde que comenzó a estudiar ya que es buena en las ventas y decidió probar el mercado. Antes de salir de la secundaria había asistido a varios cursos en los cuales aprendió técnica para el cuidado y mantenimiento del mismo. Lleva 7 años dedicándose a este negocio y le va muy bien, realiza lo que es tinturado, alisado, cortes, manicura lo que el cliente le solicite. Realiza el trabajo visitando a sus cliente previa cita ya que no a podido adecuar un local lo cual no es problema porque igual tiene clientes. Ana comenta que su mayor problema es la delincuencia ya que para dar el servicio lleva una maleta con los productos y los utensilios que utiliza como plancha y secadora de cabello, pero de momento no ha sufrido robos y espera continuar así. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de productos de belleza como esmaltes, acetona, cremas, tintes, etc., y una parte para arreglar su cuarto en la casa de sus padres. A futuro le gustaría culminar sus estudios universitarios y abrir su gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Ana, 22, sells beauty products.  This young, hardworking woman lives in Milagros in her parents’ house since she’s single.  She’s liked the activity she carries out since she started going to school since she’s good at sales and decided to test the market.  Before finishing secondary school she’d taken several courses where she learned to care for and maintain it.  

She’s been in this business for seven years now and does very well.  She does hair coloring, straightening, haircuts and manicure; whatever the customer requests.  She does the work visiting the customer based on prior appointments because she’s not been able to set up a salon which hasn’t been a problem, though, since she has customers anyway.

Ana comments that her greatest problem is crime because she has to carry a suitcase filled with her products and tools like hair straightening comb and hair dryer in order to do her work but to date she’s not been robbed and hopes to continue that way.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy beauty products like nail polish, acetone, creams, and hair color, etc. and part of it is to fix up her room in her parents’ house.  In the future she’d like to finish her university studies and open her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, creams and hair color.

loans.name: Flavia Domitila

texts.es:
La Señora. Flavia es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por una comunidad que pertenece al cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene accidentada geografía la cual le da un clima frió y grandes extensiones para disfrutar de la naturaleza fuera de la rutina de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Flavia tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos (gemelos) de 4 meses de edad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su padre pero independiente. 

Nuestra socia se dedica a las labores del campo en donde trabaja cultivando hortalizas las que las vende en su comunidad, también cría y vende cuyes, gallinas y cerdos. 

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando semillas, abono y animales.
 
Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Flavia is a member of the 'Nuevo Bankito la Ramada' community bank.  She lives in a community in Nabón canton.  This area has a very rugged landscape.  It is a cold-climate area and has large tracts of land where people can enjoy nature and escape the daily city routine.  The locals raise animals and farm.  In addition, many of them travel to the city every day in order to carry out different business activities.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Flavia is 33 years old and the single mother of 4-month-old twins.  She does not own her own home.  She lives in her father's house but independently.

Our member works in agriculture, growing vegetables which she sells in her community.  She also raises and sells guinea pigs, hens and pigs.

This is Flavia's third loan as a member of her community bank and she will invest it in buying seeds, fertilizer and animals.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and animals

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is a hardworking entrepreneur. She operates a business, buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Patrocinia has been in this business for 25 years. In addition, Patrocinia earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to stock and sell in her fruits and vegetables business like mangoes, banana, water melon, apple, oranges, cabbage, carrots, squash, string beans and spices. Patrocinia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  

In the future, she hopes to build and expand her business so that she can secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, banana, water melon, apple, oranges, cabbage, carrots, squash, string beans and spices to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 32 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a silver jewelry retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of silver jewelry.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of silver jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  modern blo-dry,hair drier , and shampoos and chemicals for treating hair

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is 56-year-old man, an Internally Displaced Person who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and one son. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 25 years. He chose this business because it is profitable, and a fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan households and also make fresh punch.

Tehran sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise his crops.

As his products are in high demand, Tehran wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 700 AZN.  He will buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija, 23, has two school going children.  Previously she worked in the home of a family and gradually saved enough money to open a small business. This way she became independent, and thanks to her sales strategy, she grew her sales and profits.

She is a very hardworking person and works every day in her small store.  Her income helps her give her children everything they need.

Hadija is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes and tomatoes. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her; it is very important support because the loan is the only opportunity she has to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 36 years old man, IDP, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. 

He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 10 years.  During these years Elchin gained enough skills and experience to run his business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma.  .He raise pears, apples, peaches, plums, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrot and potatoes.   He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar.  His monthly income is 250 AZN.

Ashis products are in high demand, Elchin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demands.  For this reason he applied for 1500 AZN loan.  He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.  This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay is a diligent man, living with his family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province.  To support family, Chhay works hard in his rice field and trades firewood for extra income. 

Chhay usually collects firewood around his commune with his cow-pulled trailer or purchases some from suppliers, and then he continually transports them to marketplaces.  He is able to make around $8 per day, which he uses to spend on food, clothes, and allowances for his three school-aged children.

At the present, Chhay is asking for a first cycle loan of $1000 to purchase a strong cow for both farming and firewood business. vThis loan will help him improve his businesses activities and he hopes to make a good income in coming years. 

Later Chhay plans to purchase farm supplies such plowing and rice mill machines for use use on his farm.  Chhay seeks to ensure a good education for all of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a strong cow.

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf is a 41-year-old man, married with three children. He is IDP and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat purposes.
