Alex is from the city of Mombasa. He is a single man and a metal welder. Alex is a very self-sacrificing person and notes that he has always worked hard and it is thanks to that work that he has been able to help his extended family.

Despite his young age Alex wants very much to continue working and helping with the day-to-day expenses of the household. He says he still has a lot worth fighting for and that is why he continues to strive.

Alex is applying for a loan to purchase tools, which will greatly facilitate his work. He wants to buy a welding machine and other masonry supplies. Alex is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: buy a welding machine and masonry supplies

loans.name: Nzisa

texts.en:
Nzisa is a married woman and has two children aged 6 and  2 years old. Nzisa is very enterprising. She set up a clothes shop two years ago. She has been renting a stall in the market to sell her clothes.

Nizisa says that when she started out, it was difficult because of the competition which existed, but with a great deal of sacrifice including going out to sell in the street, she established her clientele. She then managed to sell wholesale and is very successful. Her dream is to do business on a large scale and this is what she is fighting for.

Nzisa is requesting this loan to buy trousers, T-shirts, dresses, sneakers, shoes and other items which she will stock in order to offer a wide variety to her clients.

loans.use: buy clothing items to resell

loans.name: Bijumaa

texts.en:
Bijumaa is from the city of Mombasa and is married with a single child who is still an infant. She is very proud of her only child who pays maximum attention to her. Bijumaa lives in her own house that has piped water but no electricity. She tells us that much of her expenditure goes to food. 

She is a very hardworking person who always strives to give to her family supporting them in everything they need. She sells dumplings and peas in an open air market along a busy street. Her dream is to expand her business and establish a cafe in future.

Bijumaa is asking for the loan to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for the opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance so she can buy rice, pasta, sugar and drinks at wholesale prices. In this way, she will have a well stocked store and will earn more money. Fatuma is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, sugar and drinks at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Wakesho

texts.en:
Wakesho is single and lives in Samburu near the city of Mombasa. She is a merchant and also farms green vegetables and keeps livestock to sell milk.

She comments that she makes her sales in the interior of the village, specializing in farm produce and milk sales. She has been working at this for the last twenty years, so she has a well-established clientele. She defines herself as a very hardworking person who strives to the maximum to always help her family.

She requests the loan to buy a water pump to continue working and growing as a micro-businesswoman. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting from Kiva and Yehu microfinance.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Josephine est une veuve de 49 ans mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre  7 et 19 ans et tous vont à l'école.  Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 18 ans déjà. Elle vend les vivres frais(plantains)selon les saisons.la vente des plantains est une activité qui rapporte, mais la petitesse de son stock de marchandises entraine de nombreuses ruptures et ne lui permet pas de satisfaire convenablement sa clientèle. Ce crédit lui permettra alors de s'approvisionner en grande quantité afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité afin de devenir grossiste dans la vente des plantains et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation).
texts.en: Josephine  is a 49-year old widow and the mother of three children ranging from 7 to 19 years of age. All of the children are in school. Josephine has been working as a vendor at the local market for 18 years. She sells staple foods (plantains) in season.Selling plaintains is a profitable activity, but  because her stock is small she often runs out of merchandises and is unable to properly meet customer demand. This loan will allow her to stock up a large quantity in order to meet demand and thus increase her sales and her revenues. She will reinvest a part of her revenues into her business in order to [eventually] become a wholesaler, and use the rest to provide for her familys' needs (food and education).

loans.use: to buy bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É carpinteiro, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, chapas de zinco, areia, e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua obra e crescer profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e a formação académica dos seus filhos.
texts.en: Ernesto is married and the father of three children who go to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else besides his immediate family.  He is a carpenter.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, iron, zinc sheets, sand, etc.) to continue work on his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home and grow professionally.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is the elevated cost of living and paying for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, iron, zinc sheets, sand, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filha que vai a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É polícia e tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (farinha, arroz, refrescos, feijão, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio construindo um estabelecimento maior e adquirir uma viatura para o escoamento dos produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado preço dos produtos.
texts.en: Joaquim is married and is the father of one daughter who is in school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else besides his immediate family.  He is a police officer and has his own business selling various products.  He will use this loan to buy flour, rice, soft drinks, beans, etc., to increase his quantity of merchandise.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business by building a better location for it and by acquiring a vehicle to transport his products.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is the elevated price of his products.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, soft drinks, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has a child who is one year old. She tells us that she has had a grocery store in her home for two years. It is well stocked. In addition, she also operates a retail shop from which she gets another source of income. Mary is a very hardworking person, eager to succeed and help her family. She knows that life is hard and working is the only way to get ahead.

Mary is applying for a loan in order to establish another business keeping poultry. She plans to purchase chicks and feed and to put up a chicken house to continue providing good products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and feed and to put up a chicken house

loans.name: Acacio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É docente e quadro do Ministério de Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, tijolos, e pagar a mão de obra) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e continuar com os estudos para crescer profissionalmente, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e o bem-estar da sua família.
texts.en: Acacio is married and is the father of two children who go to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone besides his immediate family.  He is a teacher and is part of the Ministry of Education.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, and bricks) and labor to continue work on his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home and to continue with his studies so he can grow professionally.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is the elevated cost of living and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, tijolos, e pagar a mão de obra)

loans.name: Candida

texts.pt:
Casada e pai de 4 filhos que vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como agricultora, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, vitaminas, e ração para dar inicio ao negócio de criação e venda de frangos.
No futuro deseja ser uma agricultora e criadora de frangos muito conhecida, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e adquirir uma viatura para transportar os seus produtos para o mercado.
texts.en: Candida is married and is the mother of four children who go to school.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone else besides her immediate family.  She works in agriculture.  She will use this loan to buy chicks, vitamins, and feed to start a business raising and seling chickens.  In the future, she hopes to be a well-known farmer and chicken farmer.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the elevated cost of living and acquiring a vehicle to transport her products to market.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vitamins, and feed to start a business growing and selling chickens.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 2 filhos já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de mariscos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (peixe, camarão, lulas, caranguejo, frangos congelados e outros) para aumentar e diversificara a sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a instabilidade do seu negócio e o elevado custo de vida.
texts.en: Ilda is a widow and is the mother of two children who are now adults.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.  She has her own business selling seafood.  She will use this loan to buy fish, shrimp, squid, crab, frozen chickens, etc., to increase and diversify her merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to finish her home and to furnish it.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the instability of her business and the elevated cost of living.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, squid, crab, frozen chickens, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an abundant amount of food for her customers

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 4 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como operária agrícola numa empresa privada, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco. Areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado preço do material e custo de vida muito alto.
texts.en: Helena is married and is the mother of four children who go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.  She works as an agricultural worker in a private company.  She will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, zinc sheets, sand, beams, etc.) to continue work on her home.  In the future, she hopes to finish her home and to furnish it to offer her family more comfort.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the elevated price of materials and the very high cost of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, zinc sheets, sand, beams, etc.).

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance so she can buy bales of clothes at wholesale prices. Because of this, she will have a well-stocked store and will earn more money. Sarah is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman, and she has six children. She runs a very well-supplied, small store that sells fresh water. She is a very hard-working and tenacious woman, who is always making efforts to get ahead in life.

Alice told us that she started working in this field more than three years ago, because there was a need for a general store in her neighborhood. Little-by-little her business has been able to grow, thanks to her efforts.

She is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil, and baked products to sell in her new stall. Thanks to this investment, she will keep on selling high-quality products and increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil, and baked products

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Madame Fatoumata habite au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis 4 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle voyage tous les trois mois pour aller dans la sous région ou se tient un marché hebdomadaire. En partant elle achète  des habits qu’elle va revendre  et progressivement elle acquiert des produits locaux  tels que l’huile de palme,  les poissons séchés,  le citron et autres produits divers qu’elle ramène  dans la capitale et qui seront destinés a la vente. Elle est membre d’un des  guichets de la zone urbaine de  l’U-IMCEC. Elle a déjà remboursé 9 crédits antérieurs et sollicite un prêt de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’habits qu’elle va aller revendre. Son intention est d’augmenter son fond de roulement  pour développer d’avantage son activité de commerce. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices en vue de mieux supporter  les frais scolaires de sa famille et aussi augmenter le niveau de son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata lives in Senegal. She has been advancing in business for four years. Every three months, she travels to the sub-region where a weekly market is held. While there, she purchases clothing that she will resell and gradually acquires local products such as palm oil, dried fish, lemons and other various goods, which she brings back to the capital with the intention of selling them.

Mrs. Fatoumata is a member of one of UIMCEC's branches in the downtown area. She has already repaid nine prior loans and is seeking a loan of 250,000 francs intended for the purchase of clothing that she will resell. Her objective is to increase her working capital in order to better expand her business. Her goal is to increase her profits, with an eye to better bearing the educational expenses of her family, as well as increasing the amount she saves.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de cobertores e cortinas, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (mantas, duves, lençóis, micro-ondas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja construir um estabelecimento comercial condigno e uma residência para os filhos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e acesso aos financiamentos.
texts.en: Virginia is the single mother of two children who go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.  She has her own business selling blankets and curtains.  She will use this loan to buy blankets, duvets, sheets, microwaves, etc., to increase the quantity of her merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to build a nice retail location and a home for her children.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the elevated cost of living and access to financing.

loans.use: to buy blankets, duvets, sheets, microwaves, etc.

loans.name: Chrizbel

texts.en:
Chrizbel is a farmer in the Nkubu area of central Kenya. She has been active in mixed farming for five successive years. Her farm mainly produces cereals, milk, and tea for the local market. She is 26 and single. She runs a retail business alongside her farming business.

Chrizbel has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, a partner of Kiva, to buy a chuff cutter and a generator to boost her farming business. She says the chuff cutter will ease the feeding of her dairy animals. The generator will ensure a constant water supply to her farm, which will boost her banana production in addition to other things. She reiterates that farming has really improved her life in the past five years, and she can only hope for the best.

Chrizbel says the infrequent rains and the animal and crop diseases are the major challenges in her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter and a generator

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance to start a photocopying business, and to purchase a copier machine. In this way, she will have a well-stocked store and will earn more money. Nelly is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier machine

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en: Mariamu is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she has been able to better stock her store with all the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance so she can buy sacks of charcoal at wholesale prices. In this way, she will have a well-stocked store and will earn more money. Marimau is grateful to Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 49-year-old married man who has nine children, seven of whom are in school. He tells us that the first two are grown and are working and independent; one is in form three; two are in class eight; two are in class four; and the other two are in class three. Hamad lives in a flat area of a small town located in the city of Mombasa where business is common. 
He has been selling fish at the market, and he has been doing so for over six years to make a living. In addition, he also owns rental houses, which provide him with income. 
He is now requesting a loan that he intends to use to purchase a refrigerator. Hamad hopes this loan will enable him to increase his business and earn more income to provide a better standard of living and to keep his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is from the city of Mombasa. She operates a motorcycle taxi. She is married and has operated a taxi business for three years. She lives with her husband and one child who attends school.

She remarks that her job is very difficult because during the rainy season, she has a lot of obstacles since she has fewer passengers because it's cold. Her dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus make progress every day.

She is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of her business. She is happy with the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a resident of an area called Nkubu in Central Kenya, where she has been practicing mixed farming for nearly 30 years. Her farm produces French beans, maize, cabbage, and potatoes for the local market. She is married with four adult children.

Florence has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She reiterates that farming has been her main source of income and remains optimistic about generating more income. She plans to buy more land to help her produce a variety of products.

Florence says high costs of inputs like fertilizers remain the greatest challenge in farming. She, however, adds that Juhudi Kilimo loans have empowered smallholder farmers immensely.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 34 years old and she supports two people in the family. She is married to Mbithi, who contributes additional income to the family. She has two children aged 10 and 18 years.

She has been in business for two years and earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to purchase farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer. The anticipated profits will be used to buy foodstuffs and pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams in the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Bintihamad

texts.en:
Bintihamad is a divorced woman with six children, four of whom are working while two are still in school. She sells khangas (African traditional cloth) both from home and door-to-door. In addition, she sells firewood in the neighborhood.

Bintihamad is a very hardworking, responsible and very honest lady, as her customers comment. Her longtime dream was to work independently, so that she would no longer depend on someone else. Through her hard work and dedication, she achieved what she so desired and already has her own business of selling firewood.

She requests the loan in order to purchase bundles of clothes and stock of firewood, so that she can continue to offer her customers the variety to which they are accustomed. She gives thanks for the opportunity she's being given.

She also commends her working children for their support and she says that they have relieved her since her husband divorced her. Bintihamad lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water, together with her two children who are in primary school.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes and stock of firewood

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 28 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged six and one year old. She sells maize, a business she started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

She has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase eight bags of maize. She has never borrowed from any other microfinance institution. 

The profit she earns will aid her in meeting her family's basic needs. She hopes to see her business expand and to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase eight bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Bihidu

texts.en:
Bihidu is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She begins her work very early every morning and finishes late at night. After much sacrifice, she is getting ahead, and she enjoys what she does. That is why she wants to keep working in this business even after having her first charcoal selling business. She is a devoted entrepreneur who does not fear risks. Bihidu is taking out another loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase construction blocks, a business she has operated concurrently with the previous one.

She says that she would like to provide her family what they need through her work.

loans.use: to purchase construction blocks

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday is a 28-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university level. He has been in a business of timber selling and transport for four years. His main hardships are seasonal weather and high fuel and transportation costs. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include a retail shop. Monday needs a loan to buy a motor vehicle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 36-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He started by farming and used the proceeds to start his current business. His dream is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. He desires to expand the business into new markets and own one of the best boutiques in town despite the challenge of inadequate capital that hinders his business. Moses wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Main De Dieu 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Philomene, age 50, is single and has five children aged from 13 to 32. She has three children still attending school. She also cares for her elderly mother. Philomene is representing the Main de Dieu 2 (#2) group. She sells used clothing in a market in Brazzaville. She has had this business for 22 years! She has been able to acquire valuable experience and loyal customers through the years. She will use the loan to buy a large bale of used clothes from her supplier. In Congo, used clothing is sold to vendors in large bales to be sorted and sold separately.
Philomene has received three previous loans from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to one day travel abroad to buy merchandise for her business. She also plans on using the profits to fund her children’s future education.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 44-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling medicine for nine years. Her hardships are seasonal weather, inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuation, and inflation. Her personal goal is educating her children; her business goal is buying land to grow crops. Margret wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Stephano

texts.en: Stephano is a thirty-six-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the carpentry business for four years. His hardship is inadequate capital to purchase enough raw materials, and his personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent home. His business goals are to expand his business to new markets and modernize his workshop. Stephano wants money to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei has always worked with children with special needs. He grew up with a sibling who had limited vision and speech, as well as other delays. When Alexei came to the US from Cuba on his own, he came with a dream of building a rehabilitation clinic for children with special needs. He wanted to continue to give back. He worked for almost two years saving up funds so he could begin his business. His business, D & D Rehabilitation Center, works with special needs children in occupational, speech, and physical therapy. The first few months of owning the business were difficult for Alexei and his employees, as they had almost 90 children in the Southern Florida region sign up for their services. Alexei had not planned on such high demand. His facilities were anticipating 50 children.

Alexei quickly realized that he needed more money to be able to provide for the 90 children that were seeking his assistance. This loan will help with working capital as they expand their services to meet the need, and can help the growth of more children with special needs. Alexei loves working with his children and their growth is what drives him forward and puts a smile on his face daily.

loans.use: to pay for increasing care service to children with special needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 30 bags of onions and 20 bags of Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Zainab. She is married and has two children aged 14 and 9 years. 

In 1992, Zainab established her business selling grocery items like onions, salt, and oil. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in solving some domestic problems. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. Zainab has already received and successfully repaid her first loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy enough stock to meet the present competition in the market. 

In the future, Zainab plans to erect a big shop and start selling wholesale. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy enough stock to meet the present competition in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 bags of gari, 2 drums of palm oil, and 50 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 61-year-old man who is widowed and living with his two sons. They live in a rural area near the district of Tambogrande in Northern Peru. They have basic electricity services. 

Angel is an experienced and hardworking man who has dedicated the last 20 years of his life to raising animals (mainly sheep and poultry), which are sold once they reach the ideal size and weight. Moreover, he also has a small crop of lemons that he harvests on a weekly basis and sells in the local market. This helps him to have slightly diversified income streams. 

As Angel has gotten older, he has developed strong expertise in his area of activity and is very committed to his business. Hence, he is now looking to get  a loan of 1000 soles to invest in his animals and his crops. In particular, he wants to buy animal feed and fertilizers for his lemon crop. Because the area is relatively remote, the 'Capital Semilla' incentive with the support of Kiva allows Angel to have access to credit that takes into account his situation.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers for his lemon crop

loans.name: Roque Gilberto

texts.es: El señor Roque tiene 64 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 8 hijos, todos ellos trabajan y son independientes, el reside en la Colonia 4 de Mayo, de la Ciudad de Catacamas, Olancho. Don Roque  aprendió hacer tejidos de todo tipo y desde hace 20 años se dedica a realizar tejidos de hamacas, lazos, cabuyas, entre otros, el horario laboral es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm y trabaja en conjunto con dos de sus empleados, la ventaja que tiene es la rapidez con que vende su producto. El préstamo que don Roque esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de material como ser: sogas, cabuya, hilo, pago de mano de obra. Con la ayuda de este préstamo mejoraría su negocio ya que podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para elaborar su producto. Algunos de los problemas que enfrenta son la delincuencia que afecta la seguridad de su negocio. Su sueño es poder hacer crecer su negocio y lograr vender su mercadería en todo el país. Es el segundo financiamiento don Roque solicita en FAMA y ha cumplido puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Roque is 64 years old, widower and have eight sons, all of them work and are independent. He lives in the Colony 4 de Mayo, in the city of Catacamas, Olancho. Roque learned how to knit all kind of fabrics and for 20 years he has been making a living from knitting hammocks, ropes among others. He works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm with two employees. The advantage he has is the speed with which he sells his product.

Roque needs the loan to buy materials such as: ropes, ropes made of the aloes plant, thread, and pay his employees. With the help of this loan he would improve his business since he will buy the materials needed to make his product.

Some of the problems he faces is crime, which affects the security of his business. His dream is to be able to grow his business and sell his merchandise throughout the country. This is his second loan with FAMA. He has punctually paid all his quotas

loans.use: to buy materials such as: ropes, ropes made of the aloes plant, thread, and pay his employees.

loans.name: Soledad Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Soledad tiene 34 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona Norte de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Soledad  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de abarrotes por mayor para surtir su tienda, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir lo necesario, la Sra. Soledad, ella pretende ampliar la gama de productos a vender y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de abarrotes como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz, etc. su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable, que le genere más ingresos y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Soledad is 34 years old, she makes a living from the sale of staple in her store, which is located in the north part of the city of Santa Cruz. 

This is loan is her second loan with the field partner. Soledad is requesting this loan to buy goods from wholesale. The reason is that she does not have enough funds to buy what is needed. Soledad wants to widen the product offering, buying sugar, spaghetti, rice, etc. Her wish is to have a stable and profitable business, which generates more revenues and allows her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy staples to stock her store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosalía, tiene 50 años, es cliente antigua de la institución,  ya se encuentra en su cuarta secuencia, se dedica a la venta de comida, ella vende almuerzos, está sacando crédito  para compra de insumos (arroz, azúcar, papa, fideo y otros para la elaboracion de sus riquisimos platillos, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. Rosalía demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, razón por la cual se la escogió para crédito Kiva. La Sra. Rosalía tiene su negocio en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz Bolivia, ella vende almuerzos y sopa de fideo, a partir de las 9 de la mañana hasta las 22:30 aproximadamente todos los días, su principal aspiración es comprarse un terreno y tener su casa, con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien ya que siempre solicita el crédito para mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en: Rosalía is a longstanding client of the institution since she’s in her third sequence. She sells food: lunches. She is taking out a loan to buy ingredients (rice, sugar, potatoes, noodles and others). At her evaluation, Rosalía had a good, cordial and kind attitude which is why she was chosen for a Kiva loan. Rosalía has her business in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone. She sells lunches and noodle soup from 9am until 10:30pm approximately every day. Her main goal is to buy a lot and to own a house. With the previous loan she did very well since she always use it to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, potatoes, spaghetti, and others to prepare her delicious dishes

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is a 50-year-old married mom of four kids. She is living in Corrales, Jimenez, Philippines. She has been sewing for 12 years and continues to do so today. Every month, she receives 5,000, which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Merle joined Gata Daku MPC in 2010. She applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc. By having all the necessary materials, Merle hopes to create as much output as she can to have more income. She is also planning to expand in her business area and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Agustina Del Carmen

texts.es: Agustina nació hace 47 años en la ciudad de Portoviejo. Es viuda y tiene 5 hijos, cuatro son mayores de edad e independientes, Henry el menor de 17 años vive con ella y hace poco empezó la universidad. La casa de Agustina es propia desde hace 5 años, cuenta con los servicios básicos y su construcción es mixta, es decir de cemento y caña. Se dedica a la venta de producto de cosméticos por catálogos el cual empezó  hace 7 años atrás porque vio en esto una forma de ganar dinero. En la actualidad tiene mucha experiencia en su negocio y cuenta con una excelente clientela entre sus familiares, amigos y conocidos a quienes visita cuando la llaman telefónicamente. Sus recorridos los hace sola de lunes a sábado desde la las 8 de las mañanas hasta las 4 de la tarde llevando sus productos y revistas. Los que mas le solicitan son perfumes, cremas, bases, labiales etc., tiene cliente tanto femenina como masculina. El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de inventario con el cual tendría stock para la venta. Su meta es aumentar el negocio para poder terminar la construcción de la casa.
texts.en:
Agustina was born 47 years ago in the city of Portoviejo. She is a widow and has five children, four of whom are grown and independent. Her youngest son Henry, age 17, lives with her and will be starting university soon. Agustina has owned her house for five years and receives basic services. Her home was built with a mix of cement and reeds. She began selling cosmetics through catalogs seven years ago because she needed a means of earning money. Agustina has plenty of experience in this business and has an excellent customer base that includes relatives, friends, and acquaintances who visit her after they contact her by telephone. She travels alone Monday through Saturday from 8am to 4pm. Agustina carries her products and catalogs with her. The products that are most requested are perfumes, crèmes, foundations, lipsticks, and other items. Her customers include both women and men.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy inventory so that she will have stock to sell. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, foundations, lipsticks, and other items.

loans.name: Duo La Arboleda Group

texts.es: Duo la Arboleda.este duo esta integrado por doña floridalma,es viuda y tiene 5 hijos pero gracias a Dios como lo dice ella todos sus hijos ya estan grandes y la apoyan en su negocio,ella se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de tortillas,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña, y tambien dice que quiere compra un comal de gas ya que nececita sacar mas rapido las tortillas porque la demanda de sus clientes han aumentdo, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito, espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que ella nececita.
texts.en:
“Duo La Arboleda” is a pair of borrowers that includes Doña Floridalma. She is a widow and has five children. Thanks to God, she says that all of her children are grown and support her in her business. Floridalma produces and sells tortillas.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy corn and firewood. Floridalma also says that she wants to buy a gas-powered griddle because she needs to prepare tortillas more quickly due to increased demand from her customers, which is another reason why she is requesting this loan. She hopes that the support she needs will be given to her.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and a gas-powered griddle.

loans.name: Duo Lirio De Los Balles Group

texts.es: Duo Lirio de los balles. este duo esta integrado por Miriam Adela,tiene 2 hijos ya grandes y le apoyan en su negocio, ella se dedica a la elavoracion de cubrecamas, blusas,edredones,etc. ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas materia prima para seguir con su negocio, espera que le puedan ayudar y seguir apoyando en su negocio.
texts.en:
“Duo Lirio de Los Bailes” is a pair of borrowers that includes Miriam Adela. She has two grown children who support her in her business. Miriam produces bedspreads, blouses, quilts, and other items. She has been in this business for many years.

Miriam is requesting a loan so that she can buy more raw materials for continuing her business. She hopes to receives assistance and support for her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making bedspreads, blouses, quilts, and other items.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married with four children. She is 55 years old and resides in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Regina makes and sells cooked foods to earn a living. She has been in this business for 21 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. In 2011, Regina joined GDMPC. She wants to make improvements to her house and to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Laida

texts.en: Laida is 45 years old, married and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Laida owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Laida has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Laida's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another plot of farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en: Madeline is married with 2 children. She is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. Madeline is a farmer and she operates a gardening and flowering production to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years and every month she earn 3,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 4,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Madeline has been a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Madeline hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Vicenta Marcela

texts.es: Vicenta de 41 años vive en Paraíso de la Flor zona sur urbana de Guayaquil donde tiene su domicilio. Su casa como muchas del sector cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, en espera de la pavimentación y alcantarillado. Hace 16 años atrás decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes porque en su sector no había y vio la oportunidad de ganar dinero. Actualmente tiene competencia pero le va bien porque con el tiempo ha ganado clientela y sabe atender al público. Abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, no se queda más tarde porque su sector es peligroso y la delincuencia hace de las suyas en la noche. Los productos que mas comercializa son arroz, azúcar, aceite, azúcar, galletas, etc., los cuales compra cada semana para surtir la tienda. Vicenta administra y atiende a los clientes sola aunque a veces la ayuda su hijo de 12 años.  Con el préstamo compra mercadería esperando mejorar sus ventas para seguir apoyando en el estudio a su hijo. Su sueño a futuro es poder comprar un vehículo para transportar sus compras y ahorrar costos.
texts.en: 41-year-old Vicenta lives in Paraíso de la Flor, in the southern urban area of Guayaquil.  Her house, like many in her neighborhood, receives water and electricity services but is still waiting for surfacing and drains.  Sixteen years ago, Vicenta decided to open a grocery store because there wasn't one in her neighborhood and she saw an opportunity to earn money.  She now has competition but things are going well because, over time, she has gained customers and she knows how to serve the public.  She opens from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  She does not stay any later because her neighborhood is dangerous and there is a lot of crime at night.  The products that she sells most of are rice, sugar, oil, cookies, etc.  She buys these every week in order to stock her store.  Vicenta runs her store and serves her customers alone although her 12-year-old son sometimes helps her.  She will use her loan to buy merchandise.  She hopes to improve her sales so that she can continue supporting her son with his education.  Her future dream is to buy a vehicle with which to transport her purchases so that she can save on costs.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and cookies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De La Revancha  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas de La Revancha se reúne cada 15 días en el sitio La Revancha, este es un lugar en las afueras del cantón Manta, lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas y que ofrecen un sinnúmero de lugares hermosos y una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse hace tiempo  atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito que les ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como, comercio en general, venta de comida, servicios, entre otras actividades.

En este lugar vive la señora Rocio, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es supervisor en una empresa de seguridad. 

Nuestra amiga es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y  productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de catalogo ya que tiene varios pedidos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

La foto pequeña es de un socio que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Unidas de La Revancha' community bank meets every two weeks in La Revancha, on the outskirts of Manta canton.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its great number of beautiful places and the variety of its cuisine.

This is a group of people who decided to come together some time ago and form this loan group which has been very useful to them in growing their businesses.  The members work in a number of different business activities such as general commerce, food sales, services, etc.

This is where Rocio lives.  Rocio is 36 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has two children who are 17 and 5 years old.  Her children are studying in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a supervisor in a security company.

Our friend is a housewife who, in order to earn her own money so that she can help her husband with the household expenses, sells clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories) through catalogs.  She works three days a week, for two to three hours a day.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects payment once a week.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well.  She tells us that what she sells most of are perfumes and cosmetics because they are very good.

Rocio will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and catalog clothing because she has several orders.  This is her second cycle as a member of the community bank and she likes it because of the help they receive from the loans.

Rocio's dreams are to make progress and provide her children with the best in life.
 
The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Concepcion está integrado por dos socias, las cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales. La coordinadora del Grupo es Felicita, ella tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Juticalpa, su familia esta conformada por su esposo quien es Tractorista y sus cinco hijos. 

A los 18 años de edad Felicita inició a trabajar como empleada domestica y lo hizo por 13 años. Ahora ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, quesadillas y pan. Trabaja con su hija menor y con una hermana, inicia a hornear a las 4:00 am y termina a las 8:00 am y luego tiene una empleada quien es la que vende de forma ambulante los productos.

Ella solicita este préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mas materia prima como ser leña, maiz y maseca; asi de esta forma podra cumplir con los encargos de producto que algunos clientes le han hecho. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Felicita espera aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y tambien comprar 3 hornos y asi poder ser una fuente de empleo en la comunidad. Tiene cuatro años de ser cliente de FAMA y con los prestamos obtenidos ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
The 'Concepcion' solidarity group has two members who work in different sales activities.  The group's coordinator is 47-year-old Felicita who lives in the town of Juticalpa.  Her family consists of her husband, who is a tractor driver, and her five children.

At 18 years old, Felicita started working as a domestic employee.  She did this work for 13 years.  Now she makes and sells 'rosquillas' (a type of doughnut), quesadillas and bread.  She works with her youngest daughter and a sister.  She starts baking at 4.00am and stops at 8.00am.  She then has an employee who sells her products as a street vendor.

Felicita is requesting this loan so that she will have the money she needs to buy more supplies such as firewood, corn and corn masa flour.  This will enable her to fill orders for her products that some customers have made.  With the support of this loan, Felicita hopes to increase her profits, improve her household's financial situation and also buy three ovens so that she can become a source of employment in her community.  She has been a client of FAMA for four years and, through the loans she has obtained, she has been able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and corn masa flour

loans.name: Carmen Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura. 

Nuestra socia tiene 24 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuela del sector, su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Carmen se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado a sus hijos que aun son pequeños, también cría de pollos actividad en la que se encuentra hace 3 años. 

Es socia de la banca comunal hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para pollos más grande para seguir creciendo en este negocio.

Su meta es terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the 'Corazones de Turi' community bank.  She lives in Corazón de Jesús community, in Turi parish, in Cuenca.  This parish is known for the beauty of its church.  It is also known for the fact that you can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca from there.  The local people are kind, friendly, hard-working and tenacious.  They work in commerce, livestock raising and farming. 

Our member is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has two children who are 6 and 4 years old.  Her eldest son attends a local elementary school.  Her husband works in construction.  They do not own their own home but live in rental accommodation.

Carmen does her housework and cares for her children who are still young.  She also raises chickens.  She has been in this business for three years.

Carmen has been a member of her community bank for one and a half years and she will invest her new loan in building a larger chicken shed so that she can continue growing in her business.  Her goal is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to build a chicken shed

loans.name: Rosa Edelina

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa. es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.
 
Doña Rosa tiene 40 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años de edad, su primera hija cursa los estudios universitarios, su segunda hija trabaja para solventar sus gastos personales  y su ultima hija se encuentra estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el extranjero ha elegido esta dura decisión para mejorar la situación económica de su hogar y familia, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa labora en los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en casa se dedica a la agricultura, sus cosechas son para el consumo de su hogar y lo que le sobra es para la venta, también cría cuyes y ganado.

Se encuentra en el quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón más grande para los cuyes.
  
Su meta es crecer más en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Corazones de Turi' community bank.  She lives in Corazón de Jesús community, in Turi parish, in Cuenca.  This parish is known for the beauty of its church and is also known because, from there, you can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  The local people are kind, friendly, hard-working and tenacious.  They work in commerce, livestock raising and farming.

Rosa is 40 years old, married and has three children from her marriage who are 21, 19 and 17 years old.  Her eldest daughter is studying at university, her second daughter works in order to cover her personal expenses and her youngest daughter attends a high school in the city.  Her husband works abroad.  He took this hard decision in order to improve the financial situation of their household and family.  The family own the house in which they live.

Rosa does her housework and, as she spends most of her time at home, she also farms.  Her harvests are for her household's consumption and she sells any surplus.  She also raises guinea pigs and livestock.

This is Rosa's fifth loan as a member of her community bank and she will invest it in building a bigger shed for her guinea pigs.  Her goal is to make further progress in her animal-raising business.

loans.use: to build a shed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Johanna. es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, parroquia que es reconocida por la belleza de su iglesia, también es admirada ya que desde allí se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil luchadora y trabajadora, se dedican a laborar en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña Jhoanna tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Johanna nos comenta que se encuentra gozando de muy buena salud al igual que todos los miembros de su familia y agradece a Dios por sus bendiciones. 

Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de animales en su casa, actividad que la desempeña para estar con sus hijos y cuidar de ellos.
 
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en materiales de construcción para la construcción de un local para poner una tienda, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en pagar la colocación del techo de su tienda y en la compra de víveres para comenzar con este negocio. El banco comunal le gusta por las charlas de educación que reciben en cada reunión y por la atención personalizada que recibe.

Sus sueños son construir su casa y realizar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Johanna is a member of the 'Corazones de Turi' community bank.  She lives in Corazón de Jesús community, in Turi parish, in Cuenca.  This parish is known for the beauty of its church and is also known because, from there, you can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  The local people are kind, friendly, hard-working and tenacious.  They work in commerce, livestock raising and farming.

Johanna is 24 years old, married and has two children from her marriage who are 5 years and 1 year old.  Her eldest daughter attends an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works in construction.  They do not own their own home but live in her mom's house, sharing the household expenses.

Johanna tells us that she is enjoying good health, as are the other members of her family.  She thanks God for her blessings.

Our member raises animals at home.  She does this work so that she can be with her children and take care of them.

Johanna invested the money from her previous loan in buying construction supplies so that she could build premises for a store.  She will invest her new loan in paying to have a roof installed on the store.  She will also buy food products so that she can start her business.  She likes her community bank because of the education talks that they attend during each meeting and because of the personal attention that she receive.

Johanna's dreams are to build her home and to study at university.

loans.use: to pay to install a roof on her store and to buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer, married with two children, is 21 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas and root crops to earn a living. Jenefer has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 3,800 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jenefer has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. She wants to save her profits in order to buy another plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam, aged 41, lives with his wife and his three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. His three children are secondary school students. He has started to run a meat retail business with his wife's help. Baljinnyam has more than 200 livestock. His cattle are located 60 km from Suhbaatar province with his brother's livestock.  

Every summer, sheep and goats are cheaper than ever. Therefore, Baljinnyam has decided to purchase some cattle to raise with his brother's cattle. He is planning to sell them in autumn in order to increase his business income.  He is a humble and communicative man. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy more cattle at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more cattle at wholesale prices

loans.name: Dejidmaa

texts.en:
Dejidmaa lives with her husband and son in her own apartment in Darhan province, Mongolia. Her husband works as an operator for LLC. Her son is a secondary school student. Dejidmaa started her garment retail business on a rental counter in Darhan's black market in 2006. Currently, her business is sustainable and has many stable customers and suppliers. 

Dejidmaa is planning to buy a gas-fuelled car for her family's needs.  The money she has saved is not sufficient for the price of the car. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 5,040,000 MNT to buy the car. She is a clever and humble woman. Dejidmaa said, "the car is very important for my business as well as for my family. My business income and efficiency will be increased by purchasing the car."

loans.use: To buy a gas-fuelled car for her family's needs
